A scan of the surface reveals an expansive research facility spilling out of a mid-sized crater. The shield array apparently failed spectacularly some time ago, leaving the ruins awash in heavy radiation. Any material salvage operation would be unprofitable.

However, you might be able to send a salvage team down for a short period to see if any intel can be found about the purpose of this facility. Someone clearly put a lot of resources toward building it in a most inhospitable environment, far from prying eyes. Someone with something valuable to hide.
options:
0:alphaSiteExplore1:Send a salvage team down to the facility
100:defaultLeave:Leave

text:
A small satellite on a decaying orbit identifies the radiation-ravaged rock below as "Alpha Site". You estimate it doesn't have much time left until it crashes into the planet - a couple of cycles, at the very most.

On a whim, you pull up the recording of your first visit here.

id:
# this is so frivolous... orbital satellite is gone after 2 years-ish
# love it.

text:
Your $shipOrFleet goes into orbit around the radiation-ravaged rock known as "Alpha Site".

The navigation satellite which once identified this celestial body is now gone; a few taps to your display shows you the small impact crater it left when it hit the surface, a bright smudge in a plain of rad-decayed regolith. In the absence of an atmosphere, it's likely the crater will last longer than the satellite ever did, by many millions of cycles.

On a whim, you pull up the recording of your first visit here.

After extensive preparation (and reiteration of the hazard pay policy) a volunteer salvor team is sent down on a heavily-shielded shuttle.

They land near what appears to be the main entrance to the facility, and report ingress to the facility without difficulty. On a display projected into your flagship's bridge, you watch as a hardsuited salvor brushes past the clouded-over sensor unit of a defense turret; it collapses into itself at a mere touch. Anything exposed to the merciless sky is slowly crumbling on the chemical level; it appears that all groundside security systems have been destroyed by radiation.

The interior of the facility has been breached, leaving it unpressurized. While the structure's bulk provides some protection, the delicate computer systems are fried beyond repair. No data is recoverable. 

With no chance of an easy find, the team spreads out for the remaining rad-safe duration to document the facility and see if anything useful can be inferred from the ruin. While exploring, one salvor enters the quarters of a high-ranking member of the facility staff and discovers the journal, a physical book bound in natural materials, of its presumably deceased occupant.

You examine the journal in the quarantine bay. The fine leather cover is discoloured, but you can make out the embossed gold leaf Tri-Tachyon logo. Your salvage team has already scanned the text without opening the delicate pages of the book. The data has been placed in a secure cache for your review.

Scrolling the virtual pages, you find that the journal appears to hold the private thoughts of the chief technology officer of this facility. It begins with vague complaints of being ordered to disregard safety protocols during tests, and frustration with demands made by Kelise Astraia. From what you understand, this is an effort to establish a hardcopy trail in case of the blame-shifting and record-altering which is common practice for high-ranking Tri-Tachyon executives involved in failed projects.

Concerns about "going outside" feature prominently in the entries. Understandable, given the surface conditions, but the increasingly intense obsessiveness of the writing seems to reflect a growing phobia on the part of the author.

The remainder of the journal is difficult to read; most of the pages are torn or defaced, leaving a patchy, noisy scan in your display. Little of what's readable is coherent.

At the very end, there's one line, written in a clear, strong hand. "They sing to me. Everything will be all right."

The connection request hangs for some time then a wave of holo-noise flickers through the main display before generating a series of error codes. Your comms officer works their console in consternation. 

The soft sounds of the error notifications align just so, almost forming a melody you must have heard somewhere once. Or perhaps not. You return your attention to your command. No time for daydreaming.

As you approach the stark torus-hulls of Galatia Academy Station, your request to the automated docking queue is unexpectedly denied by a Hegemony-coded comm response. It’s odd that the Hegemony navy is controlling the docking procedures of this independent station.

Your primary bridge display shows an active view of a matrix of anti-ship batteries tracking your progress. Your tactical officer nods for your attention then activates a sub-display with a close-in view: a Valkyrie-class troop transport and its escorts are emplaced across the primary landing bay. They clearly don’t want visitors.

You should report to Ancyra to find out what’s going on.

As you approach the stark white torus-hulls of Galatia Academy Station, your request to the automated docking queue is denied. After a moment, the comms link opens unexpectedly to a Hegemony sigil. Encryption kicks in, and your viewscreen cuts to a harried-looking Hegemony lieutenant using a handheld comms unit.  

"My apologies, captain. The Academy is closed during the, uh, crisis. I shall have to ask you to leave immediately." 

An adjutant leans into frame and whispers something in $hisOrHer ear.

"So you’re the freelancer my CO on Ancyra got to help us out." $HeOrShe relaxes $hisOrHer tone somewhat, "I'm Lieutenant $personName. We're carrying out the investigation into who screwed up here while you take care of the problem out there. And I wish you luck, captain, because if you don't solve this it's going to get ugly.”
options:
0:gaDuringTutorialMoreInfo1:"What's going on here?"
100:defaultLeave:Thank the officer and sign off.

text:
$HeOrShe considers whether to answer your question.

"I suppose you're technically in the chain of command as an auxiliary. Right. We arrested the provost of the academy on a screenful of charges- endangering space infrastructure, negligence of habitability protocols, gross conspiracy to manipulate unauthorized technologies; it goes on." 

"And by old Earth," you note $hisOrHer jaw clenching unconsciously, "He deserves it."

"We were briefed about the experiment, but it was only supposed to cause a minor increase in comms noise, maybe some odd readings near the jump-points. Nothing like this! Obviously something more was going on, something big enough that the provost had to know about it, and-"

The lieutenant's adjutant whispers in $hisOrHer ear again. If you're not mistaken, there is some shouting in the background, barely picked up by the lieutenant's handheld comm unit.

"The mob grows restless," the lieutenant says with a joyless smile. $HeOrShe barks some orders to someone; the video feed jostles and flickers with static as they begin to move. "We'll have to chat later, captain. I'll buy you a pint on Coatl Station if you can get us out of this."

As you approach the stark white torus-hulls of Galatia Academy Station, your request to the automated docking queue is denied. After a moment, the comms link opens to show lieutenant $personName, who looks like $heOrShe could use some R&R. 

"Oh, captain. You're back? I'm sorry but we've got the academy on complete lockdown - strict orders - until the, uh, present crisis is resolved. That means no one enters and no one leaves. If you have any business with my chain of command you should speak with my CO on Ancyra." An adjutant leans into frame and whispers something to $himOrHer.

"I have to go." The lieutenant sighs. "Between you and me, these academy-types? Always asking questions, not following directions, and disagreeing with absolutely anything anyone says. I hope you resolve this mess soon."

script: AddBarEvent coatlOfficer_barEvent "Take the lieutenant up on that offer of a pint" "At the bar you see the lieutenant you met at the Galatia Academy. You recall that he offered to buy you a pint if you ever made it to Coatl."

text:
You start to introduce yourself, but before you can get two words out Lieutenant Tseen Ke interrupts you, "Captain $playerName! Of course, how could I forget? What an operation," he rolls his eyes in mock-exasperation - dealing with academicians, right?

He buys you that pint - and a couple more - as he relieves those memories. "We got 'im, you know," he says, "Kallichore. That's his name. Was the boss of the academy who okayed that mad science experiment, almost doomed everyone in the system, can you believe that?"
options:
coatlOfficer_barEvent1:Just smile and nod
coatlOfficer_barEvent2:"You're right. Totally irresponsible."
coatlOfficer_barEvent3:"Maybe the risk was worth it."

text:
The lieutenant is silent for a moment, looking at you.

Then he bursts out laughing, and slaps your back. "Hey I like you, $playerName. If you ever find yourself back around Coatl, look me up. The navy contracts out some odd jobs; you never know what might come up."

He surpresses a belch and stands, "Duty calls," then stumbles toward the lavatories.
options: backToBar:Take a look around the bar
backToBar:Take a look around the bar

text:
The stark white hulls of Galatia Academy Station crawl past in slow, magisterial rotation; the ivory tower looms before you. Your request to the docking queue is approved. Your comms officer helpfully mutes the chirpy, automated vid-feed presenting a bowdlerized history of the Galatia Academy and its role in providing education and research to the Persean Sector while remaining above political influence.

The landing promenade is filled with modest civilian transports, a few high-end personal craft, and, at the far end, a row of freighters offloading supplies. A junior academy agent greets you in a landing lounge with promotional paraphernalia in hand.
“Greetings, captain. Perhaps you are an alumni? Have you considered donating to a scholarship trust with the Academy?”
The agent smiles brightly. "Have you given some thought to setting up that scholarship fund with the Academy?"
You connect to the academy's comm directory and browse the public and otherwise known listings.

The agent launches into a polished spiel, "The Academy was founded pre-collapse, a humble institution of research and higher education on the grand frontier of the Domain. The dual foci were practical matters in the fields from applied terraforming to engineering sciences and the more theoretical pursuits including study of local astrophysics and xenobiology. The Collapse of course, changed everything, and in the following cycles... "

Your eyes wander over the people coming and going. Groups of youths full of energy and displaying earnest association with various subcultures by modifying their standard Academy uniforms- knockoff hivescum holo tags, ironic Luddic weave, Hegemony officer coats done up in off-code colors and patterns, ill-fitted spacer rigging. A few proper academicians in off-white coats study their datapads or walk swiftly in small groups to meetings and lectures.

id: # bar event telling you to go check out the GA

script: AddBarEvent goToGA_barEvent "Talk to the distinguished academician" "A distinguished, uniformed academician seems to be holding court with a handful of successful-looking ship officers." highlight

text:
As you approach, $heOrShe looks over and says "Captain $playerName! Don't look so surprised, you've got a fascinating reputation to, shall we say, movers and shakers the Sector over." 

$HeOrShe dismisses the other officers with a promise to join them in a moment, then catches your eye, "Dilettantes. Compared to yourself, I mean. I trust you've heard of the academy's new provost?"
options:
goToGA_barEvent1a:"The new what?"
goToGA_barEvent1b:"Oh, the Galatia Academy has a new chief executive?"

text:
"My apologies," $heOrShe grins apologetically, "We ivory-tower academics get so lost in our own world. Everything revolves around the next paper, the next conference."

The senior academician waves an arm to dismiss all of that. "The new provost. After that embarrassing incident with Provost Kallichore, the Academy has come under new leadership- bold leadership. To the new provost, Anahita Baird!" $HeOrShe raises $hisOrHer glass in a toast. You discover that you're holding a glass of something as well.
options:
goToGA_barEvent2a:Raise a glass
goToGA_barEvent2b:Set it down on the bar

text:
"Ah, I knew you were as intelligent as you look," $heOrShe winks

"Yes, the academy is renewing itself! After that embarrassing incident with Provost Kallichore, the Academy has come under new leadership- bold leadership. To the new provost, Anahita Baird!" $HeOrShe raises $hisOrHer glass in a toast. You discover that you're holding a glass of something as well.
options:
goToGA_barEvent2a:Raise a glass
goToGA_barEvent2b:Set it down on the bar

text: You raise your glass, and the senior academician enthusiastically hits it with their own, then downs the drink.
You set the glass down, giving the academician a skeptical look. $HeOrShe shrugs, and downs $hisOrHer own drink without your accompaniment.

"To fresh blood, my enemies slaughtered and their lands conquered. Isn't that right? I mean this in purely metaphorical terms, of course, but I daresay the Hegemony purge has cleared out the old guard and opened up some opportunities. Which brings me to you."

A hand lands on your shoulder, somewhat intrusively. "The new provost asked me to find someone like you, and now I've found you. Come to the Galatia Academy- in the Galatia system of course, but you don't need me to tell you that, ha-ha. Meet with Provost Baird."

$HisOrHer face turns serious for a moment, "She has a vision for the future, captain. And in times as extraordinary as these, she might just realize it. Hear what she has to say. Keep an open mind."

$HisOrHer tone lightens again, and $heOrShe glances at the officers $heOrShe was previously carousing with. "Now if you would pardon me, I do believe that I owe a round for my new friends. I shall see you around the Galatia Academy soon, I'm sure."

id: # Galatia Academy, first in-person meeting w/ Baird

text:
The academy agent makes a quiet request through their personal comms then gives you a patient look. "The new provost is very, very busy. New administration after the, um, recent unpleasantness, you know? This could take some time. Days, weeks sometimes. You might want to leave your comm id with me and come back in-"

The comms unit chimes softly.

"Yes? ... Really? I mean, yes, we’ll come up immediately." The agent turns to you, "Provost Baird will see you. Right now. Please follow me, captain."

You are led through a discreet secure-access door to a series of passages that bypass the public concourses. You are brought to a travel-lift which activates at the academy agent’s presence and step inside at the agent's encouraging nod.

The lift pod is wrapped by diamond-matrix through which you can watch the canyon-like sweep of plazas pass by, filled with crowds of students, academics, and technicians. Raising your gaze, you see that the pod is approaching a tiered substructure which seems to hang over the curve of the station interior. The pod slows and you shuffle to adjust to the local grav-effect field gradient. You must be near the core of Galatia Station.

A guard wearing a mirrored faceplate dismisses the junior agent and ushers you through the first doors to an antechamber filled with small groups of people who are presumably waiting to meet with the provost. They have perfect hair and perfect skin unmarred by the radiation or burns that mark a spacer. Those cybernetics you can spot are consciously stylish adornments rather than crude augments. Many have brought their young progeny with them; the stench of wealth and influence is palpable.

Heads turn as you are led past all of them toward a set of large doors which appear to be inlaid with wood from real trees. You feel their glares on you like point defense fire on heavy armour.
options:
0:gaRequestMeeting3:Play it cool. Eyes forward.
1:gaRequestMeeting3a:Smile and wink at them. You're special and know it.

text:
You enter the office as the doors close silently behind you. Provost Anahita Baird turns to acknowledge your entrance while concluding a call via her desk tablet. 

Ancient wooden shelves for real, paper books gleam darkly in subdued light emanating tastefully from nowhere. The shelves are only half-stocked from crates scattered around the office. A brass orrery of the Galatia system adorns a plinth in the center of a seating cluster. Parchments mounted behind the provost’s desk display intimidating intellectual rankings, their seals of authenticity softly glowing.

"I apologize for the mess," she says, having noted your examination. "I've only just moved office."

Before you speak she raises a hand.

"You're not here to set up a donation. Why then? Because it is very much in my interest to know about the up-and-coming mercenary captain who corrected the unfortunate situation created by my ambitious but incautious predecessor."

A pause.

"This institution is not devoted to purely theoretical work," she forms a cradle with her hands, as if to hold an idea as she explains it, "For what use is knowledge if it does not give us the power, and wisdom, to change the world for the better?"

She leaves the question hanging in the air for a moment.
options:
0:gaRequestMeeting5a:"Knowledge is good for its own sake."
1:gaRequestMeeting5b:"Knowledge uplifts the human spirit."
2:gaRequestMeeting5c:"Knowledge can also be very profitable."
3:gaRequestMeeting5d:"Knowledge brings us closer to the Creator."
4:gaRequestMeetingSayNothing:Say nothing

text: Provost Baird cuts you off as you begin to speak, "The question was rhetorical, captain."

She brings her hands apart. "My point is that the Galatia Academy could make use of someone like you. Someone capable, discrete," and here she pauses, a tactic for emphasis she appears to employ often,  "And very well paid. I do not wish to make the same mistake as my predecessor. If one wants work done properly, one must provide appropriate incentive." 

She leans back and looks to you, done speaking. For real, this time. Probably.

options:
0:gaMeetingAccept:"I'm interested. What do you need done?" (accept)
1:gaMeetingDecline:"Thanks, but I have other priorities right now." (decline)
2:gaMeetingScholarship:"Actually, I really did want to create a scholarship."
notes: # Yeah, uh, this is a bit silly. Maybe do it later. -dgb

text:
You manage to surprise Provost Baird, because she is silent for several seconds while processing your statement. "I see," she says finally, "Um. Talk to Sebestyen about that, he'll make the arrangements." The provost shakes her head once as if to clear the idea from her mind. 

"Now, where were we."

"The Hegemony saddled us with that as a disciplinary measure," the provost explains levelly. "Had they seized our assets directly, it would be a clear violation of their principle of non-intervention in matters pertaining to the politics of the Galatia Academy. They'd look little better than pirates."

"Instead, as his last act in the office of provost, they had my predecessor Tomas Kallichore sign a range of burdensome contracts before he was removed to a Hegemony oubliette." Baird smiles wryly, as if admiring the move. "Much to your benefit."

script:
$entity.acceptedProvost = true
$entity.metProvost = true
SetPersonHidden baird false
SetPersonHidden sebestyen false
BeginMission gaTTS
text:
"I shall put you in contact with Academician Alviss Sebestyen. He will be your liaison with the academy. You will receive a few mundane tasks from various departments in the Academy so that we may build a working rapport as well as provide you with the funds you require to bring your fleet up to my standards." 

She looks over her spectacles at you, "Most of all I require evidence of trust. I intend to remain provost here for a long time, and productive relationships are built on trust."

"We will speak again before long, I'm sure." She looks out the dimmed windows at the great halls of the Galatia Academy. "You cannot imagine what we shall accomplish." 

She smiles now. Not for you, but for herself.

script:
$entity.declinedProvost = true
$entity.metProvost = true
SetPersonHidden baird false
SetPersonHidden sebestyen false
BeginMission gaTTS
text:
"I see." 

The provost's tone seems to suggest that you've answered her question incorrectly. "There are other visionary space captains out there, I’m sure, who would be interested in extremely profitable work. Nonetheless, consider my offer carefully. Perhaps after some thought you will see just how reasonable it is."

She turns away, to her desk console, and activates some display which casts cool light over her face. "After you have time to properly consider my offer, contact my assistant, Academician Sebestyen. Someone will give you his comm ID."

She taps at her console. "Good day, captain."

id:
# Provost Anahita Baird conversation; note special code to show options/end it, otherwise shows market menu when you leave
??? special code doesn't seem needed any more; I removed it, let's see if it breaks... -Alex
It broke -Alex

text:
After a short wait, your connection request is accepted by an automated responder.

"You've reached the offices of Provost Anahita Baird. To secure a number in the appointment queue, please inquire with your administrative contact. This call will be terminated in three seconds."

The machine is true to its word.

Your connection is accepted immediately. An assistant appears, and they seem to recognize you without the need for introduction. "Just a moment $PlayerSirOrMadam, the Provost will be with you shortly."

After a short wait, the comms open to Provost Baird in her office. She takes just a moment to finish with some work on another holoscreen then turns to you. 

"Ah, $playerName. What brings you to me at this hour?"
You cut the comm link.

Your connection is accepted immediately. A junior assistant appears, and they seem to recognize you without the need for introduction. "Just a moment $PlayerSirOrMadam $playerName," and the display flicks to a holding pattern displaying the crest of the Galatia Academy. 

A mere moment later, the junior assistant re-appears. "I'm very sorry, but the Provost requests your physical presence for a meeting as soon as possible." Two taps on a datapad, and they continue, "A landing slot has been set aside from your arrival, $PlayerSirOrMadam. I'm sure we will be delighted to see you shortly. Please have a wonderful day."

With that, and you having not spoken a word, the line goes dark.

options: 1:gaBairdShuttle:Take a shuttle to meet with Provost Baird

text:
You find a junior academy agent pacing in the landing bay reception lounge. As soon as you enter, they look relieved and walk quickly to meet you.

"Captain $playerLastName! Thank you for coming. The provost will want to see you immediately; if you would just follow me this way, thank you."

The academy agent leads you through a series of back hallways and secure lifts toward the administrative suites occupied by Provost Baird at the core of the station. 

You are led past diamond-matrix windows through which you can see vistas of the curving internal canyons of Galatia Academy Station. The light dims, and you approach the front waiting room of the office of the provost. It is filled with representatives of the most well-connected of the Persean Sector, whose eyes focus on an interloper like the beam array of a Paladin PD system. The self-assured march of the junior agent seems to project the impression that you're performing some adjutant role - your presence is immediately ignored. 

You enter the inner office.

"Ah, Captain $playerName." Provost Anahita Baird taps something away on her desk interface and turns to address you. "I am pleased that you've come to meet with me. And for all the work you've done for my project."

She lowers her head just a degree, "You didn't think I'd be wasting your time with make-work, did you?" She considers a moment, "Well, there was some. Noise had to be introduced to the system to ensure that an outside observer would not immediately identify you as my agent."

"Which brings us to the subject I wish to discuss. Please, make yourself comfortable." Baird motions to a set of seats around a table carved from the root structure of some great tree. Hand-carved by the looks of it. The work of Luddic artisans. 

"They do fine work," she says, "Whatever their misplaced devotion."

She clasps her hands together, turning to business. "You've proven you can be trusted. And now I ask that you take a more active role in my great work."

"Saving the Persean Sector." She is content to let the words hang in the air for a moment.

"I don't ask that you like me and I won't make a sanctimonious appeal to your emotions. What I ask is that you recognize, rationally, that I am pursuing a course of action unburdened by factional demands. Indeed, this will be the foremost effort to ensure the survival of our civilization from collapse."

"We will not be saved by a retreat to homesteads on fragile balls of rock, nor by an arms race which throws precious resources into the fires of interfactional squabbling. We have to reach beyond the known, develop theories that shatter all that has come before, apply radical technologies to ensure our survival. We must reach further and higher than the Domain ever dared!" As she speaks, she raises her eyes up toward some abstraction. 

This, you think, is something she believes in.

options: 1:bairdIntro_whyMe:"Point made. What do you need me for?"
2:bairdIntro_willSee:"I guess we'll just have to see."

text:
"You have proven yourself to be... capable," she says. "These people," she waves a hand to indicate the Galatia Academy, "are very good at very specific things over which they have obsessed all their lives. But they've kept themselves too long in the ivory tower. They're soft. The world is out there," her voice rises, "And we must change it."

She lowers her voice again, speaking directly to you, "And that is why I need you."

"I imagine your self-interest would provide sufficient motivation. As you well know, we pay in cash. The prospect of the continuity of technological civilization is an added benefit, is it not?"

"Unless," she pauses, then looks at you over her AR-spex, speaking evenly "I've gravely misjudged you, and your heart is set on liquidating your fleet, donating the proceeds to charity, and taking up with a flagellant order on Hesperus... no, I've got it- you've been doing a lot of reading- well, watching dark-channel holovids mostly- and have half a mind to enlist as a political enforcer smashing teeth in for the 1000-year reign of the 'Lion of Sindria'. Did I get it right?"

Your shields hold firm under the broadside of sarcasm deployed by the Provost.
"Indeed." She leans back, interpreting your response as a stand-down.

"Your tasks will not be so simple from here on out. I expect you to be clever, to adapt to circumstances in pursuing the objectives I lay out. And." 

She pauses for a moment, considering, before continuing in a tone colder than before, "No matter what you have to do, as long as you pursue the mission goal, I will see that you are rewarded. Securing the future is worth... anything."
options:
bairdIntro_what:"What do you need done?"
bairdIntro_morality:"I'm not willing to sacrifice all sense of morality for your 'future'."
bairdIntro_safeguard:"I'm willing to do whatever it takes to safeguard the future."
bairdIntro_whatIf:"And what if I don't want to help you?"

text: "Of course not." She puts on a smile that isn't entirely friendly. "And I would never ask it of you. This is exactly why I want to give you so much leeway- so you can do this your way. The right way. You've shown that it works; I cannot deny the evidence in front of my eyes."

"Of course you are." She smiles, and you almost believe it. "That's why I asked you to help: the ability to set your feelings aside and view the situation objectively. You know what it takes to lead and to prevail. I've seen it."

"Ah, the skeptic; of course. As an intellectual, I respect that you don't simply accept my demands due to my authority. I wouldn't have called you here if I wanted an obsequious minion to leap at my every request. I already have those." 

"To your question: you'll miss out on the opportunity of your life." She speaks almost casually, like it doesn't matter what you think. But there's an edge to her voice that suggests she does care, very much. "Whatever your feelings, first hear what I have to say and then consider - rationally - what is best. I am confident that you will discover that our interests align."

"So. Hear me out."

"My predecessor, Provost Tomas Kallichore, led a series of misguided hyperspace manipulation experiments. Ah, how to put it in layman's terms?"

Baird looks troubled to have to do this, sighs, then speaks: "Captain. Your ships fly through hyperspace with special engines. The Gate network of the Domain was similar, but also very different. Kallichore thought there might be a way to use starship hyperdrives to re-open the Gates."

"Obviously it went terribly wrong, and the Galatia system was cut off from hyperspace when the jump-points were disrupted beyond usability. Though we hear some yahoo found a way to cross unstable jump-points, which is beyond irresponsible considering the chance of a resonance cascade- ah, I apologize. This is irrelevant."

"What matters is that once this mess was finally cleared up, the Hegemony descended on the Galatia Academy with a technological inspection fleet. They tore the place apart, arrested the heads of the hyperphysics department and several labs, and of course took Provost Kallichore in for questioning." 

She turns away. "And, with little delay, sentencing." 

"He was a fool, and too trusting," Baird says with contempt. "Nonetheless, we lost good people and good research. Scientific breakthroughs are built on the development of theory and, yes, even negative results."

"I need you to recover Kallichore's secret archive. We need his data from that experiment, and all the others that led up to it. The Hegemony will have kept it. They keep everything. Evidence, you see."

"We shall also need Academician Scylla Coureuse. She was a hyperspace physics researcher, the keystone of the theory team behind the jump-point experiments. The Hegemony, small-minded as they are, only arrested team leaders in the first sweep. They didn't understand that the underlying theory being tested was largely written by one particular academician who was... not suitable for leadership."

"I need you to find her."
options:
bairdIntro_archive:How can I get the Kallichore Archive from the Hegemony?
bairdIntro_scylla:Do you have any leads on this Scylla Coureuse?

text:
"Follow the aftermath of the Galatia Experiment. The Hegemony technological inspectors seized everything they thought looked suspicious, and they do like to keep records. The most direct approach would be to get access to the data vaults of the Ministry of Technology Standards. They're who you might call the 'AI Inspectors', among other roles. Not trivial," she looks amused, "but it's been done before."

"I have an old... acquaintance who has been rising quickly in the Tri-Tachyon executive ladder. His name is Rayan Arroyo, based out of Eochu Bres. He may be compelled to assist us with a human asset on this front. I'll forward you the contact information." She taps for a moment on her desk-interface.
"Let us say that his future career opportunities are on the line. Mention me. If you are firm but discreet, I believe you will find him more than willing to assist."
options:
bairdIntro_archive2b:"Rayan Arroyo. Got it."
bairdIntro_archive2a:"You want me to blackmail a Tri-Tachyon executive?"

text:
"Not at all. I," she says this with emphasis, "I was simply attentive when a Tri-Tachyon executive compromised corporate security to advance his career over a rival."

"He understands the value of the deal he made and has come out ahead compared to the alternative. You will find him quite cooperative."

"He compromised corporate security to advance his career over a rival. He understands the value of the deal he made with me." She almost smiles, "You will find him quite cooperative once you get past his inflated sense of self-importance."
"As for the prodigy of Galatia..." Baird trails off. Is that regret? The look quickly disappears.

"Coureuse was always an odd fit. Brilliant, yes, but she had a way of being distracted with involvement in, hmm, antagonistic subcultures." Baird waves a hand, dismissing the matter as sociological fluff. "Perhaps the Hegemony crackdown cured her of that childish affectation."

"Her family and, presumably, friends," you wonder for a moment if Baird has any of those, "-are from Fikenhild, in the Westerness system. You could start there."

Baird thinks for a moment, then says "If you were seen looking for Coureuse, then you may be contacted by others who are looking for her. That could be useful. You could cut a deal, get some leads."

"Alternatively, her department was operating experimental packages in the $gaFC_starName system. We have detected some ongoing telemetry that suggests these instruments are still in use by someone, though it isn't clear who." She taps her desk interface, "I've sent you the coordinates."

The provost looks at you over her spectacles. "How do you want to handle this, captain? Are you a diplomat or an explorer? Do you want to find the probes in the $gaFC_starName system or talk your way through this on Fikenhild?"
options:
bairdIntro_scylla2choiceB:Take the diplomatic path
bairdIntro_scylla2choiceA:Take the exploration path

text:
Baird nods, "Of course. You are, at heart, a... an adventurer, shall we say, aren't you."

"If you want to change your approach, you must let me know so that I can ensure you have all the information you require."

Baird nods, "I thought so. There's no problem you don't believe you can talk your way through, is there."

"If you want to change your approach, you must let me know so that I can ensure you have all the information you require."

"When you do find Scylla Coureuse, I expect her to be unwilling to cooperate. I have provided you with an encrypted message. It is an, ah, a personal appeal from myself to her. It should prove persuasive."
options:
bairdIntro_scylla4b:"I'm sure it will."
bairdIntro_scylla4a:"Will I be blackmailing Coureuse for you?"

text:
"You need not be so conspiratorial, captain," Baird admonishes, "Not everything is cloak and dagger, blackmail and bribes."

"Our ex-academician has avoided all contact with the Galatia Academy since the Hegemony arrested most of her colleagues. I quite appreciate her rational response to that campaign of scientific suppression, but now she is needed for the role she is meant to play."

"Indeed," says Baird, looking at you closely. "Her trepidation is a rational response to previous events; the investigations, arrests, the show-trial of Kallichore. But conditions have changed, and she is needed if we are to escape from stagnant local maxima."

Baird turns to the window. "I will call, Scylla will answer," she says. A proclamation?

options: bairdIntro_scylla:Do you have any leads on this Scylla Coureuse?
bairdIntro_archive:How can I get the Kallichore Archive from the Hegemony?

text: "Find the Kallichore Archive. Find Scylla Coureuse. Once you have accomplished both of these missions, the project can proceed to the next phase." Baird smiles, "And that's when things get exciting."
options:
bairdIntro_outro2:"So that's all?"
bairdIntro_project:"So what is 'the project'?"

text: Baird's smile does not reach her eyes. "You'll see."

She turns to her desk display and starts inputting a command sequence, done with you for now.

"Good day, captain," she says without looking back up, "You may check in with me via comms for additional analysis as the operation develops, though I expect you to use your initiative."

"Oh, and I've re-authorized Academician Sebestyen with mission assignment access for your file. Carrying out his little jobs might be a good cover for your real work, and will allow us to funnel you additional credits."

You feel the subtle movement of air as the doors open silently behind you. Mirror-masked guards flank a junior agent who waits to escort you back to your shuttle.

Your comms officer connects your personal terminal to the local network. You activate the audio suppression field around your command station and enter the comms ID provided to you by Provost Baird. The animated logo of some Tri-Tachyon sub-department makes a half rotation before the call is answered.

"Arroyo here. Who's talking to me?" Rayan Arroyo looks you over as if examining a starship hull for scratches. He seems to find something he doesn't quite approve of in you. 

"Who gave you my comms ID?" he demands.
options:
gaKA_arroyoProblem:"I'm told you can help me solve a problem."
gaKA_arroyoProvost:"Provost Anahita Baird."

text:
Your call connects to an automated receiver. The animated logo of a Tri-Tachyon subsidiary spins endlessly on your display. After half a minute and the second time a voice tells you that your patience is appreciated, you conclude that your call is being ignored.

Arroyo wants to discuss business in-person.

"Solve a problem." He says this as if it's a matter far beneath the worth of his attention.

"I don't solve problems, buddy. I pay people to solve problems for me. You got problems? Go talk to the shipyard and get your oxygen leak fixed. I don't care about your problem unless your problem is seven or eight figs of cash in an account that you need put to work."

He's starting to shout. You get the impression that he enjoys this sort of upbraiding. 

"Done wasting my time? Now tell me who gave you my number because I'm going to fire them right after I cut this link."

For just a moment, you think you see a wave of panic cross Arroyo's face. It's replaced by a cocky grin, "Oh, of course, of course- the Galatia Academy endowment fund. How could I forget?"

"Here," he taps at something and your comms displays an incoming set of coordinates with the code of a landing beacon. 

"Take a shuttle down. We can touch base about the fund. I'm sure the Provost has exciting plans and I want to hear all about them-" He lifts his eyes upward for a moment and lowers them again to look directly at you. "In person."

He carries on as if this was all perfectly expected. "Ever been planetside? Doesn't count if it's just the arcology. I'll give you a tour of my chalet. Spectacular views, you'll love it. See you soon."

He closes the connection before you can respond.

options: 3:gaKA_visitChalet:Take a shuttle to Rayan Arroyo's chalet on the surface

text:
Your shuttle descends into the young atmosphere of Eochu Bres, through towering battlements of clouds that cast a spray of rain over the viewport which is wiped clean in half a blink by the heat and speed of your descent.

The flight path soon deviates from the general approach corridor which has been ticking off minor use-fees from the Tri-Tachyon owned flight control: general volume access fee, priority flight lane fee, service fee, customer satisfaction insurance charge, advertisement bypass fee - you swipe the notifications off and focus on the landscape.

Leaving behind the Tri-Tach arcology, a diamond growing atop detritus piles of tiered slums. Over pipelines, a steel-blue bay, jagged fjords interrupted by ice-jams and landslides. Up and over a great crumbling escarpment like a black wave that fills the horizon; you cross a landscape of oddly-hued tundra spotted with thousands of milky-green lakes.

A new range of mountains rises on the horizon, torn in half by catastrophic workings of the terraformers, and beyond is a chaos of steep valleys populated by dwarf pine and thin white waterfalls. The nav system sounds a tone indicating imminent arrival, and you see Arroyo's private chalet: a small compound of radical geometric architecture surrounded by low outbuildings.

Your shuttle approaches an ellipsoid landing pad that appears to hang in the thin air over a gorge.

A human and a robotic servant greet you placidly as you arrive and lead you inside to a grand parlor done in dark geometric style. Gold inlay gleams in onyx tabletops, and the polished granite floor is set with tastefully patterned jewel-tone carpets placed slightly askew.

The view from the flawless sweep of diamond-matrix bay window is, as Arroyo promised, spectacular.

Rayan Arroyo is sitting at one of the bars. He acknowledges your entrance with a nod as the servants disappear. He taps his datapad with two fingers. You hear the soft signal loss ping from your datapad and your sidearm hand twitches instinctively.

Arroyo acknowledges this with the rise of one perfectly groomed eyebrow. "Calm down. Just making sure no one's listening." He flips through a series of null readouts on a datpad and, satisfied, sets it aside.

"So Baird is calling in another installment. What will that be, Captain $playerName?"
options:
gaKA_arroyoBreakIn:"I need to break into the datavault of the Ministry of Technology Standards."
gaKA_arroyoTour:"No small-talk? What about the tour?"

text:
"No," he says. He makes a show of looking around, "But it's nice isn't it?" 

"Now I could be doing anything other than talking to you right now, so let's make it quick. You know you're getting something thanks to our mutual 'friend'. What is it?"
options: gaKA_arroyoBreakIn:"I need to break into the datavault of the Ministry of Technology Standards."

text:
As soon as you say it, a smile grows on Arroyo's face. He starts laughing, and takes his time as it builds and falls. He laughs like he's strapped to a madman's rocket, with no escape. So why not enjoy the ride?

Finally, he slaps the onyx bar-top one last time and puts his head in his hands.
options:
gaKA_arroyoAMoment:Give him a moment
gaKA_arroyoSerious:"I'm serious, Arroyo."

text: "Of course." He looks out on the vista of saw-tooth mountains for a moment, then speaks with unusual passivity: "I'd just hate to start a third AI war."

He sighs and pours something from a crystal decanter into a glass, empties it. "To a deal that gets worse all the time!" 

Then pours another. He considers a moment, notices you, and tilts the decanter to offer you a drink.
He shrugs, and sips his second drink. "Stick to Baird. You'll find your vice to cope," he says.
Arroyo pours another, passes you the tumbler, and clinks his glass into yours, hard. "And Anahita Baird!" he shouts.

He slams down an empty glass. "I know someone who can do it. They're a pain in the ass but, this is key, they're crazy enough to do a job as stupid as the one you're proposing. A hacker called Gargoyle - the real one, not one of the wannabes. We've done business before. Here's the comms ID." Rayan pulls a datakey from a pocket, waves it over his datapad, and after a couple taps pushes it toward you.

"If you get any pushback, if Gargoyle throws a little tantrum, just give it back. It's all about the drama, but in the end you're already in with a job as stupid as this." He holds a hand up, "The details of which, by the way, you really did not need to tell me. The last thing I want is Hegemony counterint crawling all over my operation. Or, worse, some vampire from the Company board smelling blood."

options: gaKA_arroyoGargoyle:"Can you tell me more about this 'Gargoyle'?"
gaKA_arroyoBairdWhat:"What's Baird got on your anyway?"

text:
He gives you a look. "No. Who cares. Doesn't matter. Most of anything you'll hear about Gargoyle is made up, and half of that is true. So don't bother trying."

He leans back, looking elsewhere, content to talk to himself some more. "What's important is that Gargoyle always gets the job done. My theory is it's some kind of obsessive brain thing," he twirls a hand at his head to demonstrate. "Probably implanted a cybermod the wrong way around and got an AI instead of a frontal lobe."

"Have fun with that one," he says with a smirk.

"What Baird's got is a good investment, and the longer she waits-" he waves at the luxurious surroundings; the career of Rayan Arroyo "-the more interest she'll collect."

A shrug. "It's done well enough for me. We all make deals to get ahead, and I've seen worse. Done worse to others. Plus, I'm an asset now. You can't simply snuff an asset owned by a bigger player." 

He turns and stares directly at you, "And you're an asset now, too. Hypothetical question- what's she got on you?" He gives a cold smile. "I hope you know."

You've got what you needed from Rayan Arroyo, and with no signal on his part that you can discern, his human and robot servants appear once more.

"I won't say it's been a pleasure, but if you ever have more credits than you know what to do with or, hmm, a truly exceptional business opportunity, let's trade cryptokeys now so you don't have to track space-dust on my carpet again." 

He taps his datapad and offers it, and you perform the mundane ritual which will ensure that anyone who wants to crack your mutual comms will, at least, have to put some effort into the task.

script:
EndConversation DO_NOT_FIRE
ShowDefaultVisual
$global.gaKA_talkToGargoyle = true
Call $global.gaKA_ref updateStage
text:
Your shuttle reverses the previous route, down from the highlands, across the plateau of lakes. You spot factory-crawlers disgorging pipe and monorail pylons across the landscape, leaving long tracked trails of torn red dirt.

Across the rocky chaos, and the small cold sea, and over the mountainous slums crowned by glittering spires. Navigation pings and comms noise grows to a small roar over the heart of Tri-Tachyon, and your shuttle takes you back to orbit.

连接本地网络后，你输入{Gargoyle}的通讯ID并发起了通讯请求。你看了看你的通讯员，他们点头回应，表示做好了行动的准备。

你执行命令的瞬间，电子战控制台像在星云中穿梭的舰队那样闪亮发光。通信技师冷静地施展技巧，在导航，传感器和工程站点的协调下，与信息安全网络博弈起来。

仅仅半分钟后，电子战的风暴结束，警报也停止了，你的主屏幕从迷人而支离破碎的电子战场变成了一张神态夸张，顽皮地向你咧嘴笑着的脸。

"看来你是有备而来啊!"{Gargoyle}以过于肉麻的语气非常不正经地说，接着他转向了想象中的观众，"开飞船的家伙们集齐了足够的智慧来对付我小小的{'欢迎仪式'}!"{Gargoyle}从镜头里跳了回来，为你鼓掌，"干得好!"

"看起来你已经知道我是谁了。告诉我，为什么{Rayan}会把我的号码给你? 礼物? 贿赂? 乞求? 他终于惹上了那个吸血的傀儡军政府的麻烦了吗? 在逃避法律的制裁，需要销声匿迹?"

"你认识新朋友的时候总是那样垮着个脸吗?"
options: gaKA_gargoyleCont2:"有份工作给你，我听说你是最棒的。"

text:
"工作? 呃，不。"{Gargoyle}夸张地说，"如果我有{'工作'}过一天，你就可以把我扔到气闸然后把那个气闸扔进黑洞里了。"

黑客漫不经心地说: "不过...我还听着呢。因为你说我是最棒的，我也确实是。但我不确定你到底知不知道我是做什么的。"

一只嵌满了数据接口的手在你眼前挥了挥，接着你的屏幕被各种新闻片段填满了 - 工业设施关闭，可疑的破坏行动，数据库被黑入，政治通讯泄露，信用点缺失，幽灵舰队。

"我做的，"{Gargoyle}又一次坐直了，并且终于严肃了气来，"是施展魔法。"

"机构，政体，战舰，舰队，霸主! 卢德教会! 还有那超他妈有钱的速子科技! 这些都是由人组成的机器，而这些人不了解他们自己组成的机器。"他换上了一种嘲弄的语气，"其他人也一样，细想一下。这些神圣的大集合体只不过是场巨大的骗局!"

"但我，"{Gargoyle}敲了敲头戴式的数据端口，"我能理解。简单地说，"屏幕上伸出了一根戳着你的手指，"戳戳这里，这里，最后是那里，这一切就会化为泡影。让事情在错误的时间发展朝正确的方向发展，强者就会变成一个悲哀的笑话。一阵风，一个花哨的屁，一个破碎的薄壳。明白了吗?"
options:
gaKA_gargoyleYes:"嗯，我也这么认为。"
gaKA_gargoyleNotReally:"没有听懂。"
gaKA_gargoyleCanYou:"你能黑进霸主部门的数据库吗?"

text:
{Gargoyle}目瞪口呆地盯着你。"不你根本没听明白，你只是在装模作样，因为你觉得你不能在你的手下面前丢了面子。"

{Gargoyle}转过身去: "我为什么要自找麻烦? 开你的飞船去吧，{$playerFirstName}舰长。噼啪嘣! 接招吧，太空海盗! 简单，直接，朴实，毫无艺术感。"

他夸张地叹了口气，"真是浪费时间。我们为什么要聊这个，还聊了这么久?"
options: gaKA_gargoyleCanYou:"你能黑进霸主一个部门的数据库吗?"

text: {Gargoyle}双手托着下巴，绝望地凝视着你。"我浪费了好多时间在你身上，{$playerFirstName}。我在努力，真的。给我点事做。好吗? 否则我可能会把自己冻上那么一千年。也许那之后会发生点趣事。"
options: gaKA_gargoyleCanYou:"你能黑进霸主部门的数据库吗?"

text: "太棒了!"{Gargoyle}大叫着坐了起来，"真是个辉煌的计划，简直是霓虹灯般的黑! 哪一个部门? 还是所有部门一起?"遮阳板和网络插件开始闪烁。
options: gaKA_gargoyleExplain:"别激动 - 事实上，就一个。" (解释任务)

text:
你向{Gargoyle}解释起任务目标来 - {Kallichore}档案，前院长{Tomas}Kallichore}的个人数据，霸主的技术部门在超空间实验出了问题之后从{Galatia}学院夺走了它。

你还用避免暗示雇佣关系的外交用语解释说，{Rayan}Arroyo}将为行动提供资金。
在你说话的时候，显示着{Gargoyle}的通讯界面充满了写了一半的什么清单，参考面板和代码片段。黑客在一个又一个的鬼主意间跳跃着，权衡着各种各样的可能事件，他总是能领先你的话几步 - 但也会走偏。视觉上的混乱有点让人分心。
options:
gaKA_gargoyleCont5:"你需要点时间来理清思路?"
gaKA_gargoyleCont5a:"这任务有完成的可能性吗?"

text:
"这可能很难。我得给几个朋友寄些钱来让他们帮忙搞点事情。嗯...我们真要那么拼命? {Rayan}在买零食...我想我们得全力以赴了，没错。"

"好，现在情况是这样的 - 我的朋友会给你做一个小玩意儿，在你到达{Magec}星系的{Nova}Maxios}时那东西就该准备好了。拿上它，然后用你花里胡哨的航行技巧或者什么其他的手段把它装到{Aztlan}星系内霸主的通信中继器上。"

"安装的方法并不难掌握，你船上任何一个技术人员应该都能搞定。"

"然后就进入重点啦: 破解霸主的加密系统。我打算把几年前就掌握的一个小漏洞留到现在用。"{Gargoyle}早早地展示了胜利的气势，然后坐了回去，"多么辉煌!"

"啊，继续。所以，在通讯中继上安装了黑客装置后回来这里，当我给你一份解密数据的副本时你就可以亲自感谢我了。{Rayan}老伙计有我的愿望单。"黑客按了一下按钮，"现在 - "

黑客又按下了一个按钮，{Nova}Maxios}主轨道环附近一个小型存储设施的地址以及一个特定存储单元的号码被发到了你的数据板上。"它来咯。"{Gargoyle}笑着说，似乎在暗示这不是在开玩笑。

"在这一切准备好之前，我还有很多事情要做，所以去吧! 当我们完成任务时，{COMSEC}会大发雷霆的，哈哈!"

{Gargoyle}看向了另一个显示器并将注意力转移到了那之上，接着通讯线路断开了，网络增强器开始以越来越快的速度闪烁起来。

options: 3:gaKA_visitStorage:乘坐穿梭机去到{Gargoyle}的存储单元

text: 你乘坐穿梭机来到了太空港的大厅，身后跟着一堆保镖和技术人员。接待室的天花板很低，老式的荧光灯闪烁着。但{New}Maxios}人对他们的临时政府感到自豪; 一些当地人注意到你们正看着一个滴落的生命维持管道，微笑着互相推搡。

{Gargoyle}给你的地址将你带到了一个破旧的物流轨道环区，看起来这里的常客是不定期货船和各种走私者。你向年轻的接待员询问{Gargoyle}给你的储存单元号具体位置在哪里。

"呃，喔对了，想必您就是...{R.Boring}舰长?"店员紧张地斜视着柜台终端 - 你保持着无可挑剔的镇定，没有因为{Gargoyle}的这个小玩笑动摇 - "几分钟前我刚被告知你会来这里取货。请走这边。"

接待员领着你穿过后门 - 一扇浅色的隔板门 - 然后他僵住了: 一个穿着单调的灰色制服的苍白男人就站在门后，如同黑暗中的一个灰点。

"{Loke}先生，"接待员结结巴巴地说，"我没想到，呃，如果有人告诉我 - "

那个人 - 你猜他就是{Loke}先生 - 温和地微笑着: "我来给舰长带路。"

{Loke}没有再理会接待员，而把注意力转移到了你身上，依旧面带微笑。他冲你点了点头，转身走进了门后的黑暗中。

{Loke}先生带你经过一排排密封的存储单元，进入了一个巨大的装货港。有着有机化合物味道的什么东西在泄漏着。

{Loke}仍然温和地微笑着，他停下了脚步并挥手打开了一个储物柜。他轻声对你说: "当听到这个消息时，{Jorien}告诉我她觉得很有趣。她要我来确保你拿到{Gargoyle}让{Elissa}给你做的东西。"

他用湿润的眼睛看着存储单元，"这肯定是个好东西。"
options:
gaKA_visitStorage3:"这些人都是谁?"
gaKA_visitStorage3a:"多谢了...我想我该这么说。"

text:
他没有回答，而是恭敬地点头，说了声{"再见"}，然后走进了仓库的阴影里。

你摇了摇头，把注意力转向存储单元，里面只有一个标准货箱。你示意技术人员上前，于是他们提着各种扫描仪凑了过去; 你可不想成为{Gargoyle}的又一个{"笑话"}。

首席技术人员开始汇报: "能量源，异常的中微子。还有，嗯，轻微的超波相位失真?"

技术人员组不约而同地后退了一步，毕竟超波相位技术声名狼藉，而且从没人知道它能在这么小的空间里保持稳定。

一个小时后，当你在附近的一家咖啡馆喝完第二杯热饮时，你的数据板上传来了技术人员告知安全的消息，上边还附着结论，尽管这个设备很奇怪 - 似乎是某种手工制作的一次性超波发射器 - 它应该不会立即构成危险。

你下令把它搬到你的旗舰上。

搭乘返回{$shipOrFleet}的穿梭机时，你思考着将这个设备安装到{Aztlan}超波中继器上而不被霸主巡逻队发现的方法。一支小而快的舰队就能做到，或者相位舰船，它们的相位场可以降低被探测的范围。运气好的话，你也可以碰到巡逻队轮班的时刻...

对讲器噼里啪啦地响了起来: "舰长，我们到了。"
你的{$shipOrFleet}刚刚被一支附近的舰队探测到 - 亦或是正在被其追逐，这使得秘密安装黑客装置不可能实现。
你的{$shipOrFleet}接近了{$name}。
options:
daKA_installHack:在{Aztlan}的中继站上安装{Gargoyle}的黑客装置
defaultLeave:离开

text:
你向行动组长下达了命令，他则低声叮嘱了精心挑选的资深打捞技师一些注意事项，接着后者搭乘着货运无人机到达了中继站。

整个行动都按照事先规划好的迅速进行完毕。技师用有着低电磁信号的工具进行了几次快速切割，移除了部分舱壁，将{Gargoyle}的装置固定到位。安装在底盘上寄生微型无人机则完成了联接的关键部分 - 主要是接入光纤线路。最后，舱壁被密封完成，队员们随着货运无人机的冷气体推进器启动开始了撤退，就如他们来时一样安静。

很快，你的通讯技师收到了一个短脉冲信号，这证明{Gargoyle}的装置已经开始正常运作。

哪怕是不将{Gargoyle}那漫不经心的态度纳入考量范围，你的通讯和技术官员依然推测这样的入侵很快会被发现。趁你还没被抓个现行，马上逃走会是个正确的选择。

你在想，霸主会不会利用黑客装置反向追踪到{Gargoyle}的藏身处。速子科技不太可能迅速回应霸主的调查申请，只是这不意味着调查行动不会以"非官方"的方式进行 - 或许那种机密行动也不能用"调查"一词来形容了。

你应该尽快从{Gargoyle}那里取得档案。

你输入{Gargoyle}的通讯ID并向你的通讯技师点了点头，他已经准备好应对任何{Gargoyle}认为有趣的通讯内容了。

显示器立马显示出了一张熟悉的脸，但上边挂着一种陌生的表情: 恐惧。

"舰长，你得带我上你的船离开这里，我被他们抓到了。但在那之前，我已经完成了工作，太不可思议了。"{Gargoyle}紧张地笑了，"这是第二次{AI}战争以来最伟大的数据盗窃!" 

黑客似乎已经意识到了情况的严重性: "我认为 - 他们这次非常...极度...完全不高兴。这里已经不安全了。带我去...{Galatia}学院? {Anahita}能把我藏起来的，对吧? 看在我付出了这么多的面子上，她必须得这么做。"

options: gaKA_gargoyleWhatIf:"如果我就这么把你扔下呢?"

text:
"就是 - 我 - 所有人!"

"让我来数数我的新朋友，"{Gargoyle}开始捻着手指，"首先是霸主，{SOMSEC}想派谁来就派谁来。我估计官方追捕行动会引发外交纠纷，所以来的很可能会是持枪刺客 - 会直接杀掉我的那种。接着是速子科技，至少被霸主的鲁莽反应惊醒后他们也会派人来。还有左径分子，霸主就像个筛子一样把这事泄露给了所有的卢德小朋友们，他们会爱死这个情报的。"

"我的好舰长，让我给你总结一下: 在...喔...两三天的时间内，这个地方会因为这件事开始一场交火，随便哪个在广场上买面条的人都可能变成一个刺客或间谍。"

"没时间了! 但是 - "{Gargoyle}得意地笑着说，"我知道你想干什么。别担心，我把它锁得很好，用我的小技巧加密还备份了。如果你能找到它，哪怕是用阿尔法核心来破解它也要花费不少时间，更何况你还不知道它在哪。"

"如果我们把你们正在密谋的一切都透露给坏蛋霸主，{Anahita}教授就不会有什么时间了。所以，来接我的穿梭机呢?"

{Gargoyle}的声音变冷了: "那样你就得不到你想要的档案了，{$playerName}舰长。因为我把它锁得很好，还做了备份。顺便说一句，我掌握了包括{Rayan}Arroyo}以及你老板{Anahita}Baird}在内各种人的情报! 你当然也有份，舰长。当霸主最高领导人在全星区新闻频道上看到你让我黑掉他们宝贵的技术部门时，他会大发雷霆的。"

黑客的笑容中没有一丝温度，"要么带上我，要么你会失去一切，舰长。"

{Gargoyle}点了点头，"那样就好，舰长。我来收收我的小东西。"

你的穿梭机并没有收到交通管制员的质询; 看起来他们还不知道发生了什么，大概吧。

你下令将{Gargoyle}关到离舰桥很远的地方，来避免他干扰你的通讯技师观察周围可疑的动静。

"舰长，"你的战术技师叫住了你，"霸主舰队来了。"

该溜了。

id: # Conversation with patrol that intercepts you after you leave Magec

text:
通讯噼啪作响，仿佛获得了新生，霸主{$rank}出现在了显示屏上，双眼直直地盯着你。"独立舰队的舰长! 我命令你关闭护盾，武器和驱动系统。你涉嫌窝藏一名罪犯以及破坏霸主数据安全。"

{$HisOrHer}嘴唇傲慢地卷了起来: "霸主海军陆战队即将登船，你的数据库将被查封，你的货物也将被扣押检查。你将会失去你对{$shipOrFleet}的控制权。你不能反抗，犹豫以及不服从将被认为是反抗。现在，立刻交出你的命令代码。"

script: SetStoryOption gaKA_patrolLie general "说服霸主巡逻队你没有参与到对技术部的黑客攻击中"
text:
听到这些无异于星际海盗的蛮横命令后，你眨了眨眼。即使是霸主根据旧时代的人之领海军法典制定的法律，也会在这种情况下为你保留一些权力。你猜这个{$rank}过分鲁莽了，以至于在解释{$hisOrHer}命令时没按规矩来。

当作出思考时，你注意到霸主{$rank}的脸变成了更深的红色，对方也许把你的沉默理解成了{"抵抗"}。事已至此，不战而退可能很难。
options:
gaKA_patrolWarrant:"这些可是例外的搜查条款，你有搜查令吗?"
gaKA_patrolRefuse:"我可不接受那些条款，{$rank}。"
gaKA_patrolLie:用弥天大谎来蒙混过关
gaKA_patrolCut:你可没时间和对面耗，切断通讯
gaKA_patrolWeapons:将武器准备就绪

script: SetStoryOption gaKA_patrolLie general "说服霸主巡逻队你没有参与到对技术部的黑客攻击中"
text:
霸主{$ranks}瞪大了眼睛。"你没有资格提出要求，舰长。"{$heOrShe}几乎要抑制不住自己的愤怒，"你必须关闭所有系统，接受查封和检查，以及逮捕。"

{$HisOrHer}眯起了眼睛: "现在投降我可能会考虑宽大处理 - 假如你这个叛徒的话里没有一丝不服从的迹象。"
options:
gaKA_patrolRefuse2:"你必须有合法的搜查令。"
gaKA_patrolLie:用弥天大谎来蒙混过关
gaKA_patrolCut:你可没时间和对面耗，切断通讯
gaKA_patrolWeapons:将武器准备就绪

script: SetStoryOption gaKA_patrolLie general "说服霸主巡逻队你没有参与到对技术部的黑客攻击中"
text:
霸主{$ranks}瞪大了眼睛。"这不是一场谈判，舰长。"{$heOrShe}几乎要抑制不住自己的愤怒。"你必须关闭所有系统，接受查封和检查，以及逮捕。"

{$HisOrHer}眯起了眼睛: "现在投降我可能会考虑宽大处理 - 假如你这个叛徒的话里没有一丝不服从的迹象。"
options:
gaKA_patrolRefuse2:"你必须有合法的搜查令。"
gaKA_patrolLie:用弥天大谎来蒙混过关
gaKA_patrolCut:你可没时间和对面耗，切断通讯
gaKA_patrolWeapons:将武器准备就绪

script:
EndConversation
MakeOtherFleetLowRepImpact gaKA true
MakeOtherFleetGoAway false
MakeOtherFleetImportant gaKA false
text:
在你切断通讯的前一刻，霸主{$ranks}的眼睛瞪大了。接着画面变黑，{$hisOrHer}的咆哮随着画面的变黑变成了一片死寂。

"{$PlayerSirOrMadam}，"你的战术军官报告，"他们正在展开攻击阵型。"

你想，这已经严重违反了星区中的商贸法规，因此，相较于损害自己法理上的正统地位，霸主更有可能掩盖接下来发生的任何{"事件"}。

script:
EndConversation
MakeOtherFleetLowRepImpact gaKA true
MakeOtherFleetGoAway false
MakeOtherFleetImportant gaKA false
text:
霸主{$rank}点了点头，带着冰冷的仇恨说: "你正式暴露了自己作为反动分子和恐怖分子的身份，我从一开始就知道。"

在尖锐的爆鸣声中，通讯中断了。

"{$PlayerSirOrMadam}，"你的战术军官报告，"他们正在展开攻击阵型。"

你想，这已经严重违反了星区中的商贸法规，因此，相较于损害自己法理上的正统地位，霸主更有可能掩盖接下来发生的任何{"事件"}。

你潇洒地行了一礼。

"{$SirOrMadam}。我得说这是一场误会。我正指挥一支特别行动队追捕一名渗透进来的恐怖分子。根据{HERMES}BLACK}命令，在行动的过程中我不被允许接入霸主的通讯网络。我上司提供的任务条件也允许我独立行动。"

"{$SirOrMadam}。"你补充道，因为你觉得这样做是对的。

当你自信地说出听起来合情合理的霸主行话时，{$HeOrShe}看起来一脸狐疑。霸主{$rank}盯着你问道: "舰长，你为谁服务? 你的上司是谁?"

不能犹豫了。

霸主{$rank}的表情没什么变化。是时候来点锦上添花了。

"他根据{Chicomoztoc}协议将我的舰队作为军事辅助部队纳入了指挥，"你解释道，"所以我不得不把一整箱钚后元素留在{Raesvelg}的港口中。"

"{$SirOrMadam}。"你又补了这么一句。

这似乎有效果了，你注意到{$rank}的态度在不知不觉中软化了下来。

"{Rau}上将总是会做出一些突破底线的事，不是吗? 这很不正常，舰长，我会向上级汇报的，现在，"{$HisOrHer}抬了抬下巴，"专业人士将接管这场追捕，发送你观察到的任务目标最后的通讯信息和行动路线。"

你带着适当的失望情绪悄悄命令你的导航和通讯技师弄出一些可信的东西来，他们即兴发挥的速度令人钦佩。你看着{$Rank}，注意到{$personLastName}瞥了一眼自己的控制台后露出了满意的表情。

script:
MakeOtherFleetHostile gaKA false
MakeOtherFleetGoAway true
MakeOtherFleetImportant gaKA false
EndConversation
text:
"的确，"{$HeOrShe}说，"回去向{Rau}上将报告，建议他不要聪明反被聪明误，把常规行动搞得乱七八糟。"

{$HeOrShe}连个招呼也不打就唐突切断了通讯，你觉得有被冒犯到。

接着你回忆了一下过去，觉得当初那个在闲得无聊的夜晚，把一些注意力投入到在港口酒吧中播放的霸主纪录片上的你十分机智。

id: # Returned to the Academy with Gargoyle and archive

text:
你的{$shipOrFleet}在排队进入空间站时被打断了; 在这种情况下通常会有交通管制通讯，可这一次，取而代之地，你收到了院长办公室的直接通讯。

"舰长，"你的通讯员报告说，"她想和你说话。"

{Anahita}Baird}的形象出现了。"舰长，把你的{'特别货物'}用穿梭机直接带到这个码头。"她说，与此同时收到导航指示和对接代码的提示音响了起来，"我会等着你的。"

通讯链接被切断了。

推进器冷却时发出了咔咔声，你走下穿梭机，身后跟着{Gargoyle}。在短暂的穿梭机旅程中，黑客接二连三的提问，建议，以及对任何控制面板或触手可及的小玩意动手动脚的行为让你忍无可忍。

就和之前说好的一样，{Baird}院长带着一小队蒙面警卫和高级顾问在等着你。

"所以这便是{Gargoyle}了，"她说。

"{Anahita}，我们终于见面了!"{Gargoyle}隆重地鞠了个躬。"我很荣幸接受您的邀请来{Galatia}学院任教，"然后他站直了，面带微笑，环顾四周。"我的课程应该是什么呢? 举办派对，剧院安保工作，也许还有如何凭个人引发足以导致第三次{AI}战争的猥亵事件?"

{Baird}不高兴地笑了笑，然后示意她们那一撮人中的一位上前。

"{Gargoyle}，来见见{Alviss}Sebestyen}院士，"{Baird}用一种放在霸主战舰舰桥上也没有违和感的语气说。"现在，{Alviss}，请慷慨地带{Gargoyle}去我们准备好的客房。"

她看向了你，显然相信{Sebestyen}能处理好局面。

"舰长，我们的客人让事情变得复杂了一些，但是..."她转身看向离开接待室的两人，{Gargoyle}表面上配合着{Sebestyen}结结巴巴的建议，实际上似乎一心想着让这位院士手忙脚乱。

"看来，除了{Kallichore}档案之外，我还获得了另一项宝贵资产。当然是由于您的主动，舰长，我是不会忘记这一点的，但是 - "她环视了一下周围，挥挥手让警卫和顾问们离开了。

{Baird}指了指旁边的运输舱: "让我们去一个更适合讨论接下来的事的地方吧。"
{Baird}通过舱窗看着外边的各种管道和远方的风景，陷入了沉思。安静的氛围开始支配这个空间，你发现这可能是一个向教务长提问而不必打断她的滔滔不绝的机会。

options: gaKA_returnWhatWillHegDo:"如果霸主发现你收留了这个黑客，你该怎么办?"

text:
{Baird}看了看你，然后又别过了头。"当然，他们已经开始怀疑我了。"

"{Galatia}学院将对原始数据的查封提出上诉，并要求归还基本的科学研究材料 - 即使在旧时代人之领的法律下，这也是合规的。'这种数据泄露只能证明限制基础研究的危险，因为这样会使一些让人讨厌的家伙们在缺乏舆论监督的情况下私自探索它们'。"

"我欣然带着讽刺的意味去提出上诉，这是一场公关战争，没有顾忌的余地。我会表现得像他们对我的想象那般愤世嫉俗，他们则会对此深信不疑，因为我的表现不是表演。"当{Baird}做出解释时，你从她对这种阴谋和反阴谋的描述中感受到了她的满足感。"然而，隐藏于那之下的，"她继续说道，"是真实发生的事情。一旦他们对此有所察觉，那将成为既定事实。"

{Baird}看了看你，扬了扬眉毛，然后又别过了头。

"特别迷人，"她面无表情地说。"我已经任教二十年了，舰长。我见过更差劲的人。"

在一片寂静中，你几乎可以听到{Baird}脑子转动的声音。

运输舱在刹车的杂音中停下了，你能感觉到重力场发生的微妙变化。走下运输舱后，你注意到这似乎是一个后门，让{Baird}不用经过了已经被满是{不习惯被告知他们需要等待的重要人物}所填满的等候室。

你跟着{Baird}院长走进她的办公室，之后门悄悄地关上了。她边检查着收到的信息，边示意你在她的办公桌前坐下。

"啊，不错。"{Baird}把数据版滑到了你面前让你查看; 这是一份{Gargoyle}的行程资料，包括对{Kallichore}档案的解密的时间表。

"{Sebestyen}比看上去更能干。你也知道，他既执着又一丝不苟。"

她指了指数据板: "我们应该能在大约一周内解密档案。诚然，这些研究数据的价值不可忽视，但我们仍然需要将理论付诸实践的手段，也就是{Coureuse}。"

"注意，她并不只是一个独特的天才，"{Baird}说，话中带着一种反常的不确定性。"我们可以找到其他候选人来领导研究团队，但研究和培训...不，我没给这一步留这么多时间。我们需要{Scylla}Coureuse}。"

"尽快找到她，舰长。"{Baird}说，她转过身去开始打发你。"我们以后再多谈谈我正在为之努力的东西。"

你感觉到身后的门无声地打开了，带着面具的警卫就像周围环境中的静电一样冒了出来。该走了。

当你进入{Baird}的办公室时，你注意到{Scylla}Coureuse}正在休息区等候着。她一边点头致意，一边收起便携式工作台。

"啊，{Scylla}，好。"{Baird}走到桌子后面，轻敲几个键启动了全息投影仪。一份{Gargoyle}的行程资料出现了，其中包括对{Kallichore}档案的解密的时间表。{Baird}示意你看向画面，"{Sebestyen}比看上去更能干，他既执着又一丝不苟。"

{Coureuse}大声说道: "在组建新团队时，他帮了我很大的忙。"

{Baird}点点头表示认同，{Coureuse}继续道: "看起来我们在大约一周内就能完全解密这份档案。我也许能重新开始我以前的一些研究，当然这取决于我们最先获得的资料是什么。"

{Coureuse}看向了你: "{Galatia}的跳跃点实验 - 实验的方法并不是我期望的。但是{Tomas}院长说时间太 - "

{Baird}打断道: "院士，你不需要为自己辩解。舰长明白当我们进入实验阶段时，你们会准备好一切合理的预防措施。事实上，{$playerHeOrShe}存在会对这些实验的推进有很大的帮助。"
{Baird}院长停顿了一下，看向你，观察你对她和{Coureuse}所说的话的反应。"舰长，你一定很想知道这一切是为了什么。"
options:
gaKA_return11b1:"是的。"
gaKA_return11b2:"不尽然，毕竟报酬不错。"
gaKA_return11b3:以绝不再上当的姿态保持沉默

text:
她没有理会你的回应，继续说道: "舰长，这是为了再次连通整个银河。听到这里你应该知道了: 星门。这一切都是为了星门。"

{Baird}点了点一个数据板，全息投影仪投射出了一个三维的网状结构地图。你认出了这张图片: 这是人之领星门网络在英仙座星区的结构图。在一片很显眼的区域中交织出的密集点就是你们称呼为核心世界的地方。

"更准确地说，是为了星门能做到的事。"{Baird}说。

{Coureuse}的声音又一次放大: "这关乎自由! 那是人之领曾经用以主宰人性的东西，我们可以逃离这个残酷的小世界。我们仍然生活在他们的阴影下，我的意思是 - 霸主仍然生活在他们的阴影下，速子科技和卢德教会也是如此，没有人真正逃出去过。"

{Scylla}Coureuse}看向了缓缓旋转的星门网络示意图，"但也许我们可以，我们所有人。"

你注意到{Baird}在对方演讲时面无表情地看着{Coureuse}。作为对此的总结，院长用一种命令般的语气对你说: "一周左右后回来，舰长。我的人需要时间工作，你则应该休息一下。但要保持低调，自你在{Aztlan}搞出一些动静后，各方势力都焦躁不安。"

{Baird}看向了桌上的控制台，在浏览信息时她脸上阴晴不定。"就这样，舰长，还有{Scylla}。"
options:
gaKA_returnIntentions:"我想谈谈你对这项科技的意图。"
gaKA_returnLeave:离开

text:
{Baird}又看向了你，"这可不是什么{'科技'}，舰长，只是可能性。可能性再大也只是可能性而已。"

她转过身去开始打发你。"这事我们以后再详谈。"{Coureuse}则在拿起她的便携工作台时同情地看了看你。

你感觉到身后的门无声地打开了，带着面具的警卫就像周围环境中的静电一样冒了出来。该走了。

id: # Various bits of off-the-main-mission chain text for the Kallichore Archive characters
# Arroyo, custom contact conversation after this previous part has been played

text:
你发出了通讯请求，某种速子科技分部的商标在通讯得到应答前缓缓地转了半圈。

"这里是{Arroyo}，你是哪位?"{Rayan}Arroyo}不以为然地看着你，他的目光就像在一艘豪华的星舰上寻找着划痕。
OR
"你带来的最好是好消息。"{Rayan}Arroyo}不以为然地看着你，"记得提醒我去带你买一套合适的西装，我认识一个能把西装做得很好看的人。"
OR
"这里是{Arroyo}，有话快说。"{Rayan}Arroyo}看到是你，皱了皱眉。"喔，是你。这次又有什么事?"

id: # Talk to Rayan Arroyo re. Gargoyle after first contact

options: 10:gaKA_arroyoExpenses:"我已经找到了{Gargoyle}，不过有一笔开支，现在我来找你报销了。"
10:gaKA_arroyoExpenses:"我已经找到了{Gargoyle}，不过有一笔开支，现在我来找你报销了。"

text:
听到你这么说后{Arroyo}的脸变得更黑了。

"明白了。"他说到。

他举起了一根戴着金戒指的手指。"别再和我提关于{Gargoyle}的任何事，我很清楚自己并不想知道那个荒唐的破坏者在计划着什么。但我会给你报销。"他做了个鬼脸，"我会把我的发票寄给{Baird}院长，这样那个呆在象牙塔里的操偶大师就能明白她压榨我到什么程度了。"

"现在我要挂了。"他关掉了通讯链接。

你输入通讯ID，手悬停在发光的{"确认"}标志上。你的通讯技师点了点头，他已经准备好应对任何{Gargoyle}认为有趣的通讯内容了。

你的主屏幕从迷人而支离破碎的电子战场变成了一张神态夸张，顽皮地向你咧嘴笑着的脸。"啊，{$playerFirstName}! 你回来是为了找些有趣的事情做吗? 我有各种各样的好主意。"

id: # Talk to Gargoyle after asked to get hack device, but haven't done it

text:
你输入通讯ID，手悬停在发光的{"确认"}标志上。你的通讯技师点了点头，他已经准备好应对任何{Gargoyle}认为有趣的通讯内容了。

你的主屏幕从迷人而支离破碎的电子战场变成了一张神态夸张，顽皮地向你咧嘴笑着的脸。"喔，{$playerFirstName}，你找不到{Nova}Maxios}了? 让我帮帮你吧，我会给你一张婴儿都能看懂的星际地图。" 

你的速子平板响起了轻柔的铃声。

"读下去，读下去。找到{'M开头的Magec'}。你能搞明白的! 我相信你。"{Gargoyle}转过身去并挥手示意你离开，接着你的通讯链接自动断开了。

id: # Talk to Gargoyle after got transmitter, not installed

text:
你输入通讯ID，手悬停在发光的{"确认"}标志上。你的通讯技师点了点头，他已经准备好应对任何{Gargoyle}认为有趣的通讯内容了。

你的主屏幕上显示出了一张神态夸张，顽皮地向你咧嘴笑着的脸，没有发生任何意外。"啊，{$playerFirstName}舰长! 你一定是忘了我简单的提示。"

{Gargoyle}数着手指，"第一步，收集设备。你做到了，万岁! 第二步，把它安装在位于{Aztlan}星系的 - 现在注意了，也许你该让你愁眉紧锁的通讯员做个备忘录 - {Aztlan}中继器里。第三步，回到我这里来拿你宝贵的数据档案。"

黑客用剩下的两根手指粗鲁地朝你挥了挥。"事情就是这样。再见，我现在很忙。"

你的通讯链接自动断开了。

options: 10:gaKA_tellBaird1:告诉{Baird}关于{Gargoyle}黑掉霸主通讯中继器的计划

text:
{Baird}院长耐心地听着你的解释。当你说完时，她等了一会儿，然后干脆地说: "舰长，我只需要你完成任务，不需要知道你的每一步行动，如果这个{'Gargoyle'}是我久仰大名的那个，那么我们得到{Kallichore}档案的可能性就很大了。"

"你的行动方针很明显: 帮助黑客，用任何必要的手段，不惜任何代价。"她的语气就像失望的老师，"你肯定不需要我来告诉你这些。"

options: 10:gaKA_tellBaird2:告诉{Baird}关于{Gargoyle}黑掉霸主通讯中继器的计划

text:
{Baird}院长耐心地听着你的解释。当你说完时，她等了一会儿，然后干脆地说: "舰长，我只需要你完成任务，不需要知道你的每一步行动。"

"你的行动方针很明显: 帮助黑客，用任何必要的手段，不惜任何代价。"{Baird}看向了她桌上的显示屏，检查着她的日程表。看起来你可以走了。

你伸手想切断通讯，这时她补充道，"把这个黑客设备的规格参数发到我的办公室，我很感兴趣。"

options: 10:gaKA_tellBaird3:告诉{Baird}黑客装置已经安装完成了

text: "你安装了黑客装置，回来之前却没有从{Gargoyle}那里拿到解密的{Kallichore}档案?"{Baird}摘下眼镜站起身来，她平时的冷静消失得无影无踪，"现在快去! 抢在别人之前拿到档案! 你还等什么，快走!"

id: # talk to Scylla Coureuse, any time after she's at the academy

text:
她看了你一会儿，叹了口气: "你知道她可能在窃听，对吧? 她知道我的感受，我不会假装我很信任她。我不太喜欢她的目标和她的工作方式。但其他人都更糟糕。"

"不论怎么说，她都是个...高效的人，这比其它的选项要好。"

"我不知道，"她说，"为霸主制造武器? 让星区崩溃到超空间航行以前的水平? 为了速子科技折腾AI? 我做不到。更别提卢德教会了。"

{Coureuse}笑了，"把我送去尼姑庵吧，也许那样都没那么糟。"

"哦，当然有，"她笑着说，"你能从{Gargoyle}那里找到，呃，全新的观点。对待一些猜想，我们已经在不知不觉间形成了去解决它们的小组织。还有，嗯，还有技术层面上的东西，比如代码。这 - 呃，有点奇怪，传统意义上的团队合作基本上是不可能的。但如果我们能为{Gargoyle}找到一个独立的小项目，它可能会被处理得很好。"

"谢谢你做的一切。没有你的话，事情可能会往很糟糕的方向发展。"

script:
unset $global.gaKA_triTachyonVisit
FireBest BarShuttleDownPrintDesc
FireBest BarPrintDesc
BarCMD playAmbience

SaveCurrentVisual
BeginConversation tt_fixer false true
# so that the text can use person tokens - otherwise, text is added before the script runs
FireBest GAKA_TTStart

text:
当你扫视人群寻找潜在的工作机会时，穿着一尘不染的速子科技高管服装的{$manOrWoman}神不知鬼不觉地出现在了你面前。

"{$playerName}，我们很高兴看到您的到来。速子科技公司十分重视您对当地经济的贡献，"{$heOrShe}边握着你的手边露出了完美的微笑。

"我们能换个地方吗? 我想讨论一件特殊的事...公司业务。"
options:
gaKA_ttAsk:问问发生什么事了
gaKA_ttFollow:跟上速子科技特工

text:
不知怎么的，速子科技特工的笑容变得更加灿烂而完美。"我们只想搞清一些事情，您并没有陷入麻烦中。"

"请，"{$heOrShe}拉开了窗帘，窗帘下是一个你之前根本没有注意到的私人客座，"我们可以为您提供免费茶点。"
options:
gaKA_ttFollow:跟上特工
gaKA_ttLeave:"谢谢，但是不用。我这就要走了。"

text:
完美的微笑抽搐了一会，然后变得更灿烂了。

"我相信我们还会再见面的，{$playerName}舰长。"{$heOrShe}带着虚假的兴致说道，"我谨代表速子科技感谢您的来访。"

你离开了桌子，饮料都没碰一下。速子科技特工的眼睛跟着你，脸上不带一丝笑意。

当转身想要离开时，你感觉到脖子后面传来了刺痛感。

你漫不经心地从菜单上点昂贵的饮料，几秒钟内它就出现在了你面前。

特工注意到了你的惊讶，解释说: "每个顾客在享受我们的产品时，我们都会建立速子口味档案。将购买饮料的时间和其他特定的生理信号联系起来，并以此 - "{$heOrShe}举了举{$hisOrHer}手以示歉意，"我有时会失控，这是我的服务热情。"

你明白他想表达什么: 你正在被监视着。

"我们是来谈你的事的。"特工用手轻轻地指了指你，"不是我的事。"
options:
gaKA_ttBusiness:"我的什么事?"
gaKA_ttAppreciate:"我可不喜欢被监视。"

text:
"最近发生了一起事故，{Aztlan}中继站被瘫痪了。对于{HEGCOM}来说有这样的，呃，历史，是非常尴尬的。而随着这种尴尬而来的会是过激反应的倾向 - 考虑到他们对速子科技的偏见，那会是对我们的过激反应。现在，我们认为不愉快的{AI}战争已经过去了，还有生意要做呢。"

特工的笑容消失了，语气变得冰冷起来: "我们的股东可能会损失很多。我们不能允许紧张局势被...冒险行为而激化。"{$HisOrHer}的眼睛眯了起来，"我也没指望{Galatia}的现任院长能在她的岗位上呆多久。考虑一下你愿意和谁合作。"
options:
gaKA_ttOffer:"你是在给我开价吗?"
gaKA_ttAppreciate:"我可不喜欢被监视。"
gaKA_ttLeaveToBar:"知道了。谢谢你的饮料。" (离开)

text:
接下来的很长一段时间对方都没有做出任何回应。然后特工的微笑又出现了。

"我很高兴您能接受这个建议，"{$heOrShe}说，然后站了起来。"我敢肯定公司会和您保持联络的。谢谢您的时间，{$playerName}。我相信您会继续尊重我们在速子科技的领地以及其他地方培育的商业友好环境。"

速子科技特工消失在阴影中。你看着你那杯没碰过的饮料，一个气泡缓缓地上升，并在触及液面时破裂了。

特工又一次露出了{$hisOrHer}那完美的微笑。

"进入速子科技领地的行为表明您已经同意了某些条款和条件，您明白我在说什么。此外，"{$heOrShe}维持着完美的微笑。"考虑到一直以来的伙伴关系，我认为您了解的远不止于此。"
options:
gaKA_ttNothing:保持沉默
gaKA_ttBaird:"这是关于{Baird}和{Galatia}学院的事? 还是{Gargoyle}? 又或者{Arroyo}?"
gaKA_ttLeaveToBar:"知道了。谢谢你的饮料。" (离开)

text:
{$HeOrShe}站了起来，用{$hisOrHer}眼睛俯视着你: "速子科技公司感谢您的合作，并祝您一路平安。我相信您会继续尊重我们在速子科技的领地以及其他地方培育的商业友好环境。"

速子科技特工消失在阴影中。你看着你那杯没碰过的饮料，一个气泡缓缓地上升，并在触及液面时破裂了。

特工看上去很紧张，{$hisOrHer}淡定消失无踪，东张西望起来，让你感觉四处都有眼线。

"够了，舰长。"{$heOrShe}把声音提高了一些，打断了你的话，"我想我们都说完了。"{$HeOrShe}站了起来，用{$hisOrHer}眼睛俯视着你: "速子科技公司感谢您的合作，并祝您一路平安。"

速子科技特工消失在阴影中。你看着你那杯没碰过的饮料，一个气泡缓缓地上升，并在触及液面时破裂了。

script:
unset $global.gaKA_hegemonyVisit
FireBest BarShuttleDownPrintDesc
FireBest BarPrintDesc
BarCMD playAmbience

BeginConversation heg_agent false true
# so that the text can use person tokens - otherwise, text is added before the script runs
FireBest GAKA_HegStart

text:
你开始扫视人群，寻找线索。当环视房间时，你注意到了一个穿着霸主制服的{$manOrWoman}。{$HeOrShe}在{$hisOrHer}胸前抬起了手，同时对{$hisOrHer}身边穿着制服的民事官员说了些什么。

你转过身去寻找隐藏的出口，却看到更多的霸主特工出现了 - 看他们的姿势，你猜测他们用小型武器瞄准了你的保镖，你的保镖也以同样的方式做出回应。

在正门，你看到了闪烁的近红外瞄准激光束，顺着光束你可以看到轻型战术外骨骼的剪影。当顾客们意识到正在发生不寻常的事情时，房间里的谈话声消失了，留下的只有全息影像发出的噪音。当你带着在太空战斗中磨练出来的直觉来处理这种情况时，时间的流动好像放缓了。

顾客们以一种非常随意的方式离开了酒吧，低着头，好像他们突然想起来自己还有一个会议要参加，已经来不及喝完他们的饮料了。

"我为这混乱的状况道歉，{$playerName}舰长。"霸主军官一边接近一边说道。{$HeOrShe}有一口流利的黄昏学院口音，看起来是那里最优秀的人之一。

"这是规矩。"{$heOrShe}假装听天由命地说。你感觉到一群沉默的霸主特工在你身后伺机而动。霸主军官示意他们稍安勿躁，然后说: "我们坐下来谈谈吧。让霸主请你喝一杯，那很不错，对吧?"

在这件事上你似乎别无选择。在了解情况之前，你最好配合一下。

酒保满头大汗，把两杯酒放在你们之间的桌子上，匆匆走开了。

"我相信你已经听说了{Aztlan}星系最近发生的不愉快的事，对吧? 这场数据泄露是一件可怕的事情。你是学历史的吗，舰长? 如果是的话你会明白这是可能引发战争的，所以我们非常想确保我们的调查是...结论性的。"

"我们知道当时你的{$shipOrFleet}就在附近 - 当然，"{$heOrShe}愉快地笑了，"我并不是在指控你。我只是在想你应该会有一些爱国精神，就如任何一个遵纪守法的好公民一样，愿意报告你是否有...看到任何东西"

options: gaKA_hegDidntSee:"我确定当时没看到任何东西，阁下。"
gaKA_hegHacked:"被你发现了。正是我黑入了{Aztlan}中继站。"
gaKA_hegGoons:"爱国精神，是吧? 只是这样的话那群打手是怎么回事?"
gaKA_hegTriTach:"看起来速子科技又一次打败了你们。"
gaKA_hegArrest:"我被逮捕了吗? 没有的话我可以走了吗?"

text:
"的确，"{$heOrShe}皱起眉头盯着你。"如果我们检查一下你的传感器日志，也许会发现一些你忽视掉的东西。"

但这需要搜查令，而搜查令需要非常明确的不法行为证据。霸主当然可以凌驾于任何条件之上，他们也可以制造条件，但你知道他们的官僚机构行动缓慢。

"你见过或者听说过任何叫{'Gargoyle'}的人吗? 你知道，提供信息可是有大量报酬的。"
霸主军官皱了皱眉头。"我可不是来对严重的安全漏洞开玩笑的，舰长。我知道你名声在外，那让你十分值得关注。在霸主开始认真对待你之前，你最好低调一些。"

霸主官员假笑了一下，然后对着{$hisOrHer}袖口说了一句什么。你注意到填满房间的霸主特工消失了。"请原谅我们。我的一些...同事们对我们的会议形式提出了一些不同的建议，我也只能妥协。"

{$HeOrShe}自然地看了看你: "我主张的是非正式的聊天，舰长。那样对我对你对霸主都有好处。"

{$HeOrShe}对着{$hisOrHer}袖口说了句什么。你听到了{"浪费时间"}这样的话。

霸主官员突然站了起来，撞到桌子并让一些没喝的饮料洒了出来。"滚出这个酒吧。如果我们发现你与另一起{'神秘事件'}有关，我向你保证，我们不会再这么仁慈了。"

{$HeOrShe}怒气冲冲地走出了前门，酒保则面无表情地看了你一眼。
options:
gaKA_hegLeaveSorry:"我很抱歉。"
gaKA_hegJustLeave:径直离去

text:
"你没有被捕，公民，"{$heOrShe}如此承认道，但官员的脸随着逐渐涌上的怒火变得僵硬起来，"你知道，我只是想让谈话轻松一点。霸主的安全确保了整个星区的安全 - 人们能自由地贸易，生活以及生存。与霸主过去所面临的情况相比，现在是轻松的时期。舰长，不要在这里树敌。"

霸主官员突然站了起来，撞到桌子并让一些没喝的饮料洒了出来。"如果我们发现你与另一起{'神秘事件'}有关，我向你保证，我们不会再这么仁慈了。把这当作官方警告吧。"

{$HeOrShe}大步走出了前门，酒保则面无表情地看了你一眼。
options:
gaKA_hegLeaveSorry:"我很抱歉。"
gaKA_hegJustLeave:径直离去

text: 酒保缓缓摇了摇头。今天的生意没了，没什么好说的。

id: # Finding Coureuse story mission, aka gaFC

text: "哦?"你从{Baird}的语气中听不出她的态度，就好像她的决断正处于无法确定的量子叠加态一般，"如果你想改变你处理这事的方法，确保这是你的最终决定，舰长。"
options:
gaFC_BairdSwitchToProbesFinal:"我想用探索的方法来处理这事。"
gaFC_BairdSwitchNeverMind:"当我没说。"

script:
$global.gaFC_switchedPaths = true
$global.gaFC_pickedBranchProbes = true
Call $global.gaFC_ref updateStage
FireAll PopulateOptions
text:
"很好，"她说，"那就走探索的路吧。我会确保你能得到执行修改后的任务所需的资料。"

{Baird}把目光投向了她桌上的显示屏，读着什么东西。"舰长，我猜你没别的事了吧?"
"哦?"你从{Baird}的语气中听不出她的态度，就好像她的决断正处于无法确定的量子叠加态一般。"如果你想改变你处理这事的方法，确保这是你的最终决定，舰长。"
options:
gaFC_BairdSwitchToFikenhildFinal:"我想用外交谈话的方法来处理这事。"
gaFC_BairdSwitchNeverMind:"当我没说。"

script:
$global.gaFC_switchedPaths = true
$global.gaFC_pickedBranchFikenhild = true
Call $global.gaFC_ref updateStage
FireAll PopulateOptions
text:
"很好，"她说，"那就走外交谈话的路吧。我会确保你能得到执行修改后的任务所需的资料。"

{Baird}把目光投向了她桌上的显示屏，读着什么东西。"舰长，我猜你没别的事了吧?"

options: 2:gaFC_visitFikenhild:搭乘穿梭机到地面上并寻找和{Coureuse}有关联的人。

text:
在波光粼粼的海面上，你的穿梭机穿过风暴云柱，航向了{"Kay-arco"}，{Fikenhild}的巨型生态理想城。你开始回顾{Baird}给出的与{Coureuse}有关联的人的名单，穿梭机上的阻尼力场将进入大气层的噪音减小到了耳语一般的程度。

{Adonya}Coureuse}是目标依然在世的家人，对方住在一个退休人员区。

从她开始调查应该是合理的。

你开始回顾{Baird}给出的与{Coureuse}有关联并住在{Fikenhild}上的人的名单。

{Bione}Lata}是目标的一位{"儿时玩伴"}，住在一个远郊社区。

也许她对{Scylla}Coureuse}早期的个人交际网络了解得更多。至少任何其他顺着类似线索进行追查的特工都应该联系过{Bione}。

你开始回顾{Baird}给出的与{Coureuse}有关联并住在{Fikenhild}上的人的名单。

{Cavin}Pharoh}的档案里有一部分是关于下城区激进分子在某个艺术合作社举办的活动的。

他似乎是那种惯于躲避当局的人。也许他，或者他认识的什么人在帮{Coureuse}。你在{Cavin}的协会中浏览一些被认为是艺术品的小全息图，你通过其中的内容判断，当地的{DomSec}可能已经将{Cavin}列为追捕对象了。
你开始回顾{Baird}给出的与{Coureuse}有关联的人的名单。看来你已经将最有可能的线索调查完毕了。不过，你又有了有力的新线索可以追查。
你在交通枢纽驻足了一会，考虑着下一步该怎么走。

在返回穿梭机的路上你复习了{Baird}给你提供的信息以及你自己的笔记。在质询平民这方面你并不太熟练 - 也许调查一下{Scylla}或她身边的人仍在{$gaFC_starName}星系中使用的探针，会发现更多详细的线索。

你想起{Baird}院长告诉过你，如果你想要改变寻找{Scylla}Coureuse}的方式的话需要先知会她。

你返回了你的穿梭机，思考着你找到的线索。你感觉到你想要的答案已经近在咫尺。

你停下了不耐烦地轻敲数据板的动作; 通讯目录依然显示在屏幕上。

"我没有叫这个名字的同事。"{$HeOrShe}看起来很生气。

"我接听你的电话是因为促进与主要个体商户的星际贸易属于我的职权范围。如果你只是想找通讯ID，我建议你去找公共搜索终端。"

"现在，你有什么真正的业务要谈吗?"

"我并不知道那是谁。"{$HeOrShe}看起来被惹恼了，"因为我不是通讯目录。"

"我来这里是为了协调英仙座联盟的民事和军事资产，以确保{Fikenhild}及本星系的安全得到保障。如果你有任何与这些问题有关的业务需要讨论，我将很乐意提供帮助。"

{$HeOrShe}听起来不是特别高兴，但你的外交直觉告诉你最好不要指出这一点。

id: # ask around the bar on Fikenhild

script: AddBarEvent gaFCfikenhild_barEvent "四处打听{Scylla}Coureuse}相关的信息" "这不过是瞎摸，但你依然可以试着问问这里有没有人知道关于{Scylla}Coureuse}的事"

text:
你四处打听那位失踪院士的事，不断为别人买着价格适中的饮料，试图从他们的嘴里套出一些情报。这是一个星航者聚集的酒吧，尽管星航者们总是试着互帮互助，你却依然没法找到什么有价值的情报，你得到的更多的是对方的耸肩和道歉。

一个老星航者接过了你的饮料: "院士，是吗? 如果你想调查不久前在{Galatia}发生的事，我建议你把话说清楚。当时霸主很快就介入了。表面上说想要搞清楚跳跃点的问题，但我听说这事的背后还有个人工智能，就像...在操纵着一切。"
options:
backToBar:找个借口溜走
gaFCfikenhild_barEvent2:"一个不为人知的{AI}正在策划入侵核心星区?"

text:
星航者眨了眨眼，深深地喝了一口，然后用更小的音量开口了。"是啊，你看，如果他们有能力关闭跳跃点，他们现在需要做的就只是打开星门，砰!"

对方一拳砸在桌子上，弄得几个空瓶子晃来晃去。

"入侵舰队! 他们已经为此准备了两百年。看，这都说得通了 -  在星门关闭的那一刻，卢德的家伙们都消失了，你知道这意味着什么吗?"
options:
backToBar:找个借口溜走
gaFCfikenhild_barEvent3:"卢德和{AI}搞在了一起?"

text:
星航者又喝了一口，接着说: "正是如此，时机太完美了，明白吗? 卢德和他们一起开始了这一切，鼓吹我们应该抛弃我们的科技。你明白了吗?"

星航者有些不安地环顾四周，然后低下头，说话的声音已经几乎是耳语了。

"他们在为入侵我们做准备。我们关停了他们的工厂，船只，武器然后又是工厂，"对方转着一根手指，向你展示着这个可怕的循环。"你明白了? 因为你 - 如果你仔细思考，那种卢德从未被全息影像捕捉到的说法，至少我是明白了一些东西。卢德就是一个人工智能，是那群人工智能之一。它们让我们误入歧途。你知道这意味着什么吗?"
options:
backToBar:找个借口溜走
gaFCfikenhild_barEvent4:"领导人们其实都是机器人?"

text: 星航者又喝了一大口，喝光了杯子里的酒，然后带着期待的目光看着你。
options:
backToBar:找个借口溜走
gaFCfikenhild_barEvent5:继续给星航者买酒

text:
酒保注意到了你，转了转眼珠，"噢，你听到的故事可真是真啊，"然后转向星航者。"你! 我跟你说过，不交钱就别想喝酒。我不允许你到处乱讲你的疯狂故事来打扰已经付了钱的客人。滚出去!"

白发苍苍的星航者给了你一个带着歉意的微笑，敬了个礼，然后摇摇晃晃地溜走了。

你驻足了一会，欣赏着{Kay-arco}交通网络上那些眼花缭乱的标识，耸了耸肩，等着你的速子平板规划好去{Adonya}Coureuse}住所的最佳路线。

你搭乘环道快车前往大都会的远郊，巨大的生态建筑在你眼前闪过; 在海洋下方工作的工人们搭乘着小型载客电梯踏上了回家的路途，电梯中充斥着他们身上的汗味和机油味; {Kay-arco}建筑中高塔的一部分从你眼前晃过，成千上万的窗户在阳光的照耀下闪闪发光。

你跟着速子平板的提示穿过了一个有着层叠住宅的中心区，走过了挤满退休人员和精心照料植物的安静的广场，来到了{Adonya}Coureuse}住所的大门前。

你按下了门铃，还没来得及说出来访的理由，就被邀请进去了。

{Adonya}对有客人来访一事非常高兴，在你还不知道发生了什么事情并做出拒绝之前，对方已经把一杯晾好的茶塞到了你手里。

你刚提到她的女儿，{Adonya}就滔滔不绝起来。"这女孩太聪明了，可对她来说这不是好事。就像她父亲一样。"{Adonya}回忆了一下过往并摇了摇头，但谈起{Scylla}时她还是一脸骄傲。"上次来访的人说他们的问题就到这里，他们难道一无所获? 但是看看你!"她带着赞赏的目光看着你的制服，"你也是太空舰队上来的人吧?"

你设法避免回答这个问题; {Adonya}将{Westernesse}国王主持庭审的全息影像音量调低了些，但这不妨碍她在对画面中的诉讼程序评头论足和询问你的私人问题之间轻松切换: 你没有道出自己的确切年龄，也没说自己结婚与否，只是承认自己确实在指挥一支太空{$shipOrFleet}。她似乎并不介意你含糊不清的回答。

你终于抓住了问出你想问的问题的机会。
options:
gaFC_fikenhildAdonyaA:"在我之前打听{Scylla}消息的是谁?"
gaFC_fikenhildAdonyaB:"你知道{Scylla}在哪吗?"
gaFC_fikenhildAdonyaC:确保你的行动被可能存在的间谍看到

text:
{Adonya}继续看着与{Westernesse}有关的丑闻。"那人是联盟舰队来的 - 又或者是{DomSec}? 你们这些人总是把自己的身份信息搞得模糊不清。这就是那个新国王 - 一开始让人印象深刻，但如果你只取悦当地人，{Kazeron}的大人物总会能抓住你的把柄，这就是我的猜测。再让这丑闻发酵一个星期，大家都会意识到{'Adonya说的是对的'}。"

"对了，他叫什么名字来着...{Finlay}什么的? 他留下了一个通讯芯片，以防我有其他问题。我有打过去，但得到的只是自动回复，你敢信? 所以我把它扔了。让他亲自道歉吧。"她微笑着说，"我更喜欢你一些。"

你愉快地点了点头。一个叫{Finlay}的探员，可能为英仙座联盟的情报机构工作。十分有趣。

你等着噪音平息下来，然后以稍大的音量问出了你的问题。{Adonya}在把注意力投回全息影像前瞥了你一眼。{Westernesse}的国王正在对一群水生生物学家发表长篇大论。

"这与政治有关，不是吗?"过了一会儿，{Adonya}说。"{Scylla}终于惹上了大麻烦。我不止一次和她说{Cavin}是个灾星，但她说那只是{'艺术的东西'}。我可能只是个唠叨的母亲，但我不笨。"她对着全息影像比了个表示强烈情绪的手势，茶从她的茶杯中溅了出来，"或许我应该狠狠地教训她一顿，那或许残忍，但至少没有人会在愚蠢的街头打斗中死去。"

她叹了口气，"要是{Scylla}和{Elissa}安顿下来就好了，满足于小打小闹就好，不会弄出太大的风浪。之前我就和她父亲说过一次，他也很明智地听了我的建议。"

"啊，你们这些衣着光鲜的间谍还没搞清那是谁?"{Adonya}看起来乐了，她笑着放下了茶，"现在你还得找个老太太帮忙? 别担心，我会告诉你的，舰长。"
 
"{Elissa}Zal}，是个好女孩。她本来会是{Scylla}一生的挚友。但是，"她摇了摇头，"{Galatia}学院先发来了邀请。由院长提供全额奖学金。{Sikar}很激动; 他的小科学家得到了他从未得到的机会。"

她的话音渐低，脸上带着悲伤的表情。

"哦，让我想想，"{Adonya}说。"不...我记不起来了，已经过去了这么多年。"她向你投来了一个狡黠的微笑，"但我们可以问问。"

"速子管家，"她大声说。随着{Westernesse}国王的影片被调至静音，可以提供服务的提示音从全息娱乐机器上传了出来。"请给我{Elissa Zal}的通讯ID。"

"正在搜索，"速子管家说，然后停顿了片刻，"本星系中找不到{Elissa}Zal}。"

{Adonya}看起来很失望，喃喃着{"愚蠢的东西"}。她又看了看你，"亲爱的，你还要喝茶吗?"

看起来你该走了，你瞧瞧把{"Elissa}Zal"}这个名字加到了值得留意的人的名单上。

你以对这住所阳台景观的称赞打断了{Adonya}对国王一个{"脑袋进水了的"}顾问的批评。{Adonya}上钩了，邀请你到户外喝茶。你踏入了阳台中，感受着拂面的海风，全息影像的音量降低到了几乎听不清的程度。

对面的塔楼上有着成排的阳台和窗户。井然有序地排着队的无人机嗡嗡作响，忙着递送包裹或打扫卫生。{Adonya}解释说，与其他大厦相比，这一栋的租约条款很优厚，她还问你是否考虑过退休后去{Fikenhild}。你微笑着点头，转来转去，以便让可能在拍摄的成百上千个摄像头拍下你的照片。如果真有人在监视，他们肯定会知道你来过这里。

完成了你来这里的目的后，你在离开的时候向{Adonya}Coureuse}道歉，向她保证你会找到{Scylla}并确保她的安全。并且如果有任何新的线索，你绝对会告诉她。

门在你身后轻轻地关上了，耳朵远离了全息影像无休止的低语和{Adonya}滔滔不绝的追问。当伸手去拿数据板时，你发现手里还拿着一杯放凉了的茶。离开之前，你小心翼翼地把它放到了门前。

你乘坐电车到了{Kay-arco}的郊区，这是一座宏大的半潜式的生态设施，众多浮动都市形成的网络就这么挤在它底端。电车的单轨在阳光下闪耀着光，笔直向地平线延申，就像安装在挂载点上的粒子长矛射穿了星云。

当电车冲破了云层，你感觉到了因为减速产生的微妙拉力与反引力场效应之间的对抗，你到达了你的目的地：一个模块化的郊区聚集地。你瞥了一眼你的{TriPad}，想起了这个地方的名字，{"Seabank}Oasis"}。

script:
ShowPersonVisual true bione_lata
FireAll GAFCQuestionBioneAgentName true
text:
在一个外院的门口你嗡嗡得按动着门铃，墙顶半透明玻璃条中露出了一丝绿色的草坪。在短暂的延迟之后，通讯板被激活了，一个看起来很疲惫的女人出现在全息图中。你询问她是不是{Bione}Lata}，是否介意回答一些关于{Scylla}Coureuse}的问题。

她看了看身后，然后压低声音回答。"是的，不是已经有人来问过她了吗? 就像我说的，我已经很多年没有见过{Scylla}了。听着，我不想再花很多时间回答这种问题。"

options: 0:gaFC_fikenhildBioneA:"你能告诉我关于{Scylla}本人的情况吗"
10:gaFC_fikenhildBioneB:"是谁在之前拜访你问这些问题的"
20:gaFC_fikenhildBioneC:"告诉我这个与你谈话的{'Finlay特工'}的信息"
30:gaFC_fikenhildBioneD:确保周围的人把你的行为看在了眼里

text:
"好吧。就像我说的，我不知道她现在到底掺和了什么事。我认识{Scylla}的时候，她......工作很努力，成绩很好，准确说，在她认为老师没错的情况下，她的成绩都很好。还有，"{Bione}现在笑了，"她不会退步。"

"而且我不知道，她对{Elissa}--嗯，{Elissa}Zal}相当认真。就像我告诉另一位调查员的那样，她发生了一些事情，但我不知道具体情况。她更多地在下城区闲逛，和那个叫{Cavin}的家伙在一起，卷进各种麻烦，然后......" 你听到从通讯板和院墙那边传来的婴儿的细微哭声。"我真的得走了--再见，调查员......不管你叫什么名字。"
{Elissa}Zal}，这个名字是新的线索，你在{TriPad}上迅速记下了这些信息。
通讯面板跳转，跳舞的海堤绿洲吉祥物取代了{Bione}的脸，它提醒你，未登记的客人将在工作结束时被要求离开郊区。
"哦，嗯，那是几个星期前。{Finlay}? 哦，你是说舰队情报部的{Siyavong}特工，{Finlay}是他的名。你一定是来自{Westernesse}国内安全部，对吗?"
options: gaFC_fikenhildBioneB2:做出无可奉告的动作，比如点一下头

script:
SetPersonHidden siyavong false
$global.gaFC_knowSiyavongContact = true
AddTextSmall "Received comms ID for Finlay Siyavong" highlight
text:
"这很合理，联盟部门从不与星球当地部门协调，是吗? 好吧，你们这些人从不交流与我无关。{Siyavong}探员留下了一张通讯卡。"

"在这里，"她按了几个键，出现了一个{ID}字样。当你用你的{TriPad}调出联系信息时，你听到从通讯面板和院墙那边传来的婴儿的细微哭声。"我真的要走了--再见，调查员，嗯，没听清你的名字--抱歉!"

通讯面板跳转，跳舞的海口绿洲吉祥物取代了{Bione}的脸。你瞥了一眼你{TriPad}上的新通讯联络人，一个叫{Finlay}Siyavong}的人。

"哦，嗯，那是几个星期前。他人很好，穿得很好。{Finlay}特工...{Finlay}Siyavong}，他是舰队情报局的人。你也来自舰队，对吗?" 

你做了一个不置可否的动作，点了一下头。

"嗯，他问了很多问题。你就不能和他谈谈吗? 我真的有急事...... "你从通讯板和院墙那边都听到了婴儿的细微哭声。"我现在得走了。对不起，调查员，再见。"

通讯板跳转，跳舞的海银绿洲吉祥物取代了{Bione}的脸。特工{Finlay}Siyavong}，可能是为英仙座联盟的情报部门工作，有意思。

你退后一步，用你响亮的、"指挥官的声音"说话：首先你向{Bione}表明你只是在跟进上一次特工的访问，然后强调她是在跟{$playerName}说话。你仔细地念出你的名字，保证在查询时不会打错字，无论是通过语音还是文字。

在通讯板前踱步，你再次提到{Scylla}Coureuse}，但主要是谈论的是你自己，以及配合官员的工作有多么重要。一个邻居从隔壁单元的窗户里探出头来，对你的噪音感到不快，但在你的目光接触下就退了回去。

你的表演太精彩了，以至于你花了点时间才意识到，{Bione}的声音通过小小的通讯板传来，想引起你的注意。

"你好! 嗯，{$playerFirstName}是吗? 你能小点声吗? 我的..." 你听到从通讯板和院墙那边传来的婴儿的细微哭声。

{Bione}的神情变得强硬，你这次真搞砸了点什么。"...我真的得走了。再见。"

通讯面板跳转了，跳舞的海银绿洲吉祥物取代了{Bione}的脸。它提醒你在访问郊区社区时要小声点，你今天过的不愉快吗。

你点头，转过身去，正好看到另一个邻居用惊愕的眼神看着你，数据板已经准备好打电话投诉了。
你转身向单轨线走去，对你的任务笔记进行了更新。一片雾气滚滚而来，使明亮的阳光变得暗淡。

转运电梯下降到{Kay-arco}的地下区域。空气中弥漫着霉菌和有百年历史的机器润滑油。你穿过充满廉价公寓、贩卖灰色地带商品的零售商和边缘思想的结构隧道。

你的{TriPad}指引你到一个地址，在那里{Cavin}Pharoh}举办了在通知中所说的"激进意识进行中"的活动。在一片不知名的关闭的仓库门中，你发现了一扇安全门，两边全是腐烂的化学品以及煽动性的印刷品。在入口处躺着药晕过去的人。你感觉你找对地方了。

script:
$siyavongDidInterrupt = true
FireAll GAFCCavinInterruptOptions
ShowPersonVisual true siyavong
text:
当你举起手准备敲门时，门边的通讯器喷出了火花，并发出了声音。

"你已经表达了你的来意，{$playerName}"。

一个有官腔的声音，虽然被损坏的通讯器略有扭曲。这是一种受过精英教育的象征，说话者自然而然带有一种浅浅的权威感。

"你想让我们知道你在找{Scylla}Coureuse}，你要在{Fikenhild}的每个街角大喊，就是要让我们知道。"
"你的推测是正确的，舰长。" 这个声音听起来对你留下了深刻的印象。
"你还真是顽固，舰长。" 这个声音听起来有一丝恼怒。
"我有充分的理由，"那个声音耐心地说道。

script:
SetPersonHidden siyavong false
$global.gaFC_knowSiyavongContact = true
AddTextSmall "Received comms ID for Finlay Siyavong" highlight
text:
"我们应该在更谨慎的环境下谈谈，舰长，"那个声音继续说道，"我会把我的通讯{ID}发给你。别管这个无政府主义者的巢穴了。回到上面来，让我们面对面地谈谈我们的共同利益。" 

当通讯面板发出噼里啪啦的响声时，你的数据板发出了响声。看起来你终于引起了你正在寻找的人的关注。
options:
gaFC_fikenhildCavinLeave:离开 - 你已经得到了你要的东西
gaFC_fikenhildCavinKnockAnyway:还是要敲门

script:
ShowDefaultVisual
$option = gaFC_fikenhildCavinKnock 0
$global.gaFC_knockedAnyway = true
FireBest DialogOptionSelected
Call $global.gaFC_ref updateData

text:
门边损坏的通讯面板发出噼里啪啦的声音，"--你是星球安全部? 我们不同意搜查! 除非你有-"，然后是一些低沉的话语，第二个声音打断道："闭嘴。我来处理。" 

门后的门闩被收回，一个男人走了出来。他对你摆出一副酸溜溜的表情，身着混杂着近似于太空人的装备和一些当地象征反主流文化的装饰品。出来后他把门拉上，用很低的声音说："别管这里面的事了。她是不是又卷进更多的麻烦里了? 那件关于{Galatia}的事，是吗?"

"是的。很明显。" 他看了看你，"你不是星球安全部或舰队的人。你是个雇佣兵? 还是某种间谍? 你的朋友已经在这里到处打探消息了，我们告诉他滚去舔{Kazeron}的靴子。"

Cavin}不耐烦地交叉着双臂，看着远处的维生管道，竭力表现出他根本不想鸟你。"所以你呢?"

options: gaFC_fikenhildCavinB:"我希望帮助{Scylla}，你知道她在哪里吗"
gaFC_fikenhildCavinC:"你知道了舰队情报局已经黑入了门上的面板，还是不知道?"
gaFC_fikenhildCavinD:"有人说{Elissa}能帮我找到{Scylla}，你知道她在哪吗" (撒谎)

text:
Cavin}打量了你一会儿。"所以你不和他一起工作是吗?" 他拍了拍通讯板，"听到了吗，大桶猪? 不是舰队。你输了。"

他回头看你。"呃......让我想想，是{Finlay}。叫{Finlay}特工什么的。他试图呼吁我'作为联盟公民的爱国主义'，并向我亮出了他的舰队安全部的身份。哈! 真是一个没有灵魂的正统奴才。" 

舰队安全部--他指的是英仙座联盟的内部情报机构。有意思。

"我不知道你在玩什么，呃，不管你叫什么名字的队长。你不应该和我说话。这很危险。" 他的胸更挺了一点，想让自己带着"危险人物"这个标签。

"听着，免费给你一个建议：如果现在有件事情对你--还有{Scylla}--都好，那就是滚出这个星球。所以不要再来找我了，好吗?"

Cavin}拍了拍通讯面板，解开了门栓。他回头看了你一会儿，但思索一会后还是消失在建筑中了。

Cavin}扬起下巴，挑衅地说。"我宁愿相信你说的话。我告诉{Syclla}她在转去{Galatia}学院时不可能不...做出妥协。" 他说这个词时，好像是在骂人。"他们要么进入她的大脑，要么，要么..."他的下巴咬紧了。

他吸了一口气，低下头，然后静静地继续说："她认为她在做一件比这一切更伟大的事情，你知道。改变世界。把我们从一个封闭的笼子中解救出来。整个英仙座，我的意思是，现在发生的这些战争和毁灭。我不知道我是否相信这件事真能发生。但如果有人能想出，想出办法，我不知那道是什么办法，但那人一定是{Scylla}。"

script:
$global.gaFC_knowElissasName = true
AddTextSmall "Received comms ID for Elissa Zal" highlight
SetPersonHidden zal false
SetPersonPortrait zal "zal2"
$global.gaFC_gotZalContactFromCavin = true
text:
"我得走了。你向我询问没有意义。如果有人知道她在哪里，也许是{Elissa}。"

他环顾四周，然后把他的身体放在你和门的通讯面板之间，并拿出一个山寨的数据板，上面显示着一个通讯{ID}。他保持沉默，但表情几乎是在恳求你。你迅速用你的{TriPad}扫描这个字符，它发出了成功的鸣叫声。

"这不是我该说的，但{Elissa}可能知道些什么。问问她吧。只是......不要再到这里来。"{Cavin}拍了拍通讯面板，解开了门栓。

他回头看了你一会儿，但想了想，还是消失在建筑中了。

听了你的话，{Cavin}惊恐地转头看向通讯面板。它发出噼里啪啦的声音并开始说话--{Cavin}吓了一跳，但是面板传出是你之前听过的那个声音，而不是那个带有官腔的舰队特工。

"我告诉你，他们在监视我们! 我告诉你! 我告诉过你!"

"闭嘴!"{Cavin}用拳头捶打着通讯板，"别再偷听了，你这家伙!" 他回头看你。"你到底是谁? 你为什么要告诉我这些?

options: gaFC_fikenhildCavinC2:"只是想让我们的{Finlay}朋友的工作更有意思一点"

text:
Cavin}看着你，感到困惑。"嘿，我不知道你跟谁做事。我不认识什么特工或什么--" 通讯牌噼里啪啦地打断了他的话。"我就和你说过他们是间谍，{Cavin}! 我赢了! 我赢了!"

他敲了敲身后的通讯板，"他们不是舰队，白痴!" 然后回到你身边，"

通讯板发出噼里啪啦的声音，"对，{Cavin}! ，让这些蛀虫滚去吸真空!"

Cavin}拍了拍通讯面板，门闩收回，{Cavin}退到了门口。"不要再来找我了。我不会再待在这里。"

门被重重地关上了，在门周围的海报上吹出一阵涟漪。一堆碎屑飞到了地上

script:
$global.gaFC_knowElissasName = true
AddTextSmall "Received comms ID for Elissa Zal" highlight
SetPersonHidden zal false
SetPersonPortrait zal "zal2"
$global.gaFC_gotZalContactFromCavin = true
text:
Cavin}看着你，不解地问。"你知道{Elissa}? 谁--"他下意识地看了看你身后的街道。"不，别告诉我。"

"我得走了。你不应该和我说话。我--如果有人知道{Scylla}在哪里，也许是{Elissa}。" 他环顾四周，把他的身体放在你和通讯板之间，并拿出一个山寨的数据板，上面显示着一个通讯{ID}。他快速向你点头。你迅速扫描了这个字形。你的{TriPad}发出了完成的鸣叫声

"说真的，"Cavin说，"不要再来这里了。" 

他拍了拍通讯板，解开了门栓。他回头看了你一会儿，但想了想还是消失在建筑中了。

你清了清嗓子，然后说得很大声，"{Cavin}Pharoh}。我知道你是{Scylla}Coureuse}的一个伙伴。我想让你回答一些问题，以便我进行调查，请配合"

Cavin}身后的通讯器发出噼里啪啦的声音，并说："{Cavin}! 我就说他们是舰队安全局的特工，我告诉过你! 不要告诉他们任何事情!"

Cavin}的脸色逐渐苍白，看起来像一只被捉到的动物。他拍了拍身后的通讯面板，嘶吼道："闭嘴!"然后回头看你，"还有你--也闭嘴!"。我不... 我不认识你，我什么都不知道。不要和我说话!" 他回到通讯面板上，"打开，这人就是个疯子。"

门闩缩回，{Cavin}退到了门后。在门被关上之前，他最后一次喊道，"离我远点!"。门被重重的关上了，在门周围的海报上吹出一阵涟漪。一堆碎屑飞到了地上。
你从这个破烂的门廊转过身来。看来是时候给一个叫{Finlay}Siyavong}的人打个电话了。
你从这个破烂的门廊转过身来，考虑你最后的选择。似乎{Elissa}Zal}是离{Scylla}最近的人，而且她把自己藏得很深。是时候再打一个电话了。
你从这个破烂的门廊转过身来，考虑你的选择。似乎{Elissa}Zal}是最接近{Scylla}的人，而且她把自己藏的很深。{Finlay}Siyavong}问了很多关于{Scylla}的问题，所以他可能知道些什么。是时候再打一个电话了。

当你开始转身离开这个破烂的门廊时，通讯面板再次发出噼啪声。它说话了。"你已经表达了你的来意，{$playerName}"。

一个有官腔的声音，虽然被损坏的通讯器略有扭曲。这是一种受过精英教育的象征，说话者自然而然带有一种浅浅的权威感。

"你想让我们知道你在找{Scylla}Coureuse}，你要在{Fikenhild}的每个街角大喊，直到我们知道。"

options: 30:gaFC_fikenhildCavinLeaveInterruptC:"你不像是{Cavin}Pharoh}，也不像是他的朋友"

text: "你的推测是正确的，舰长。" 这个声音听起来对你留下了深刻的印象。
"你还真是顽固，舰长。" 这个声音听起来有一丝恼怒。
"我有充分的理由，"那个声音耐心地说道。

script:
AddTextSmall "Received comms ID for Finlay Siyavong" highlight
SetPersonHidden siyavong false
$global.gaFC_knowSiyavongContact = true
$option = gaFC_fikenhildCavinLeaveEnd 0
FireBest DialogOptionSelected
text:
